visible.name: enumerated
visible.docString: Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible).

showlegend.name: boolean
showlegend.docString: Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend.

legendgroup.name: string
legendgroup.docString: Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items.

opacity.name: number
opacity.docString: Sets the opacity of the trace.

uid.name: string
uid.docString: Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions.

ids.name: data_array
ids.docString: Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type.

customdata.name: data_array
customdata.docString: Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements

meta.name: any
meta.docString: Assigns extra meta information associated with this trace that can be used in various text attributes. Attributes such as trace `name`, graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `rangeselector`, `updatemenues` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. To access the trace `meta` values in an attribute in the same trace, simply use `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` item in question. To access trace `meta` in layout attributes, use `%{data[n[.meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` and `n` is the trace index.

selectedpoints.name: any
selectedpoints.docString: Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect.

hoverinfo.name: flaglist
hoverinfo.docString: Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired.

uirevision.name: any
uirevision.docString: Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.

y.name: data_array
y.docString: Sets the y sample data or coordinates. See overview for more info.

x.name: data_array
x.docString: Sets the x sample data or coordinates. See overview for more info.

x0.name: any
x0.docString: Sets the x coordinate for single-box traces or the starting coordinate for multi-box traces set using q1/median/q3. See overview for more info.

y0.name: any
y0.docString: Sets the y coordinate for single-box traces or the starting coordinate for multi-box traces set using q1/median/q3. See overview for more info.

name.name: string
name.docString: Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover. For violin traces, the name will also be used for the position coordinate, if `x` and `x0` (`y` and `y0` if horizontal) are missing and the position axis is categorical. Note that the trace name is also used as a default value for attribute `scalegroup` (please see its description for details).

orientation.name: enumerated
orientation.docString: Sets the orientation of the violin(s). If *v* (*h*), the distribution is visualized along the vertical (horizontal).

bandwidth.name: number
bandwidth.docString: Sets the bandwidth used to compute the kernel density estimate. By default, the bandwidth is determined by Silverman's rule of thumb.

scalegroup.name: string
scalegroup.docString: If there are multiple violins that should be sized according to to some metric (see `scalemode`), link them by providing a non-empty group id here shared by every trace in the same group. If a violin's `width` is undefined, `scalegroup` will default to the trace's name. In this case, violins with the same names will be linked together

scalemode.name: enumerated
scalemode.docString: Sets the metric by which the width of each violin is determined.*width* means each violin has the same (max) width*count* means the violins are scaled by the number of sample points makingup each violin.

spanmode.name: enumerated
spanmode.docString: Sets the method by which the span in data space where the density function will be computed. *soft* means the span goes from the sample's minimum value minus two bandwidths to the sample's maximum value plus two bandwidths. *hard* means the span goes from the sample's minimum to its maximum value. For custom span settings, use mode *manual* and fill in the `span` attribute.

span.name: info_array
span.docString: Sets the span in data space for which the density function will be computed. Has an effect only when `spanmode` is set to *manual*.

fillcolor.name: color
fillcolor.docString: Sets the fill color. Defaults to a half-transparent variant of the line color, marker color, or marker line color, whichever is available.

points.name: enumerated
points.docString: If *outliers*, only the sample points lying outside the whiskers are shown If *suspectedoutliers*, the outlier points are shown and points either less than 4*Q1-3*Q3 or greater than 4*Q3-3*Q1 are highlighted (see `outliercolor`) If *all*, all sample points are shown If *false*, only the violins are shown with no sample points. Defaults to *suspectedoutliers* when `marker.outliercolor` or `marker.line.outliercolor` is set, otherwise defaults to *outliers*.

jitter.name: number
jitter.docString: Sets the amount of jitter in the sample points drawn. If *0*, the sample points align along the distribution axis. If *1*, the sample points are drawn in a random jitter of width equal to the width of the violins.

pointpos.name: number
pointpos.docString: Sets the position of the sample points in relation to the violins. If *0*, the sample points are places over the center of the violins. Positive (negative) values correspond to positions to the right (left) for vertical violins and above (below) for horizontal violins.

width.name: number
width.docString: Sets the width of the violin in data coordinates. If *0* (default value) the width is automatically selected based on the positions of other violin traces in the same subplot.

text.name: string
text.docString: Sets the text elements associated with each sample value. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (x,y) coordinates. To be seen, trace `hoverinfo` must contain a *text* flag.

hovertext.name: string
hovertext.docString: Same as `text`.

hovertemplate.name: string
hovertemplate.docString: Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plotly.com/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available.  Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`.

side.name: enumerated
side.docString: Determines on which side of the position value the density function making up one half of a violin is plotted. Useful when comparing two violin traces under *overlay* mode, where one trace has `side` set to *positive* and the other to *negative*.

offsetgroup.name: string
offsetgroup.docString: Set several traces linked to the same position axis or matching axes to the same offsetgroup where bars of the same position coordinate will line up.

alignmentgroup.name: string
alignmentgroup.docString: Set several traces linked to the same position axis or matching axes to the same alignmentgroup. This controls whether bars compute their positional range dependently or independently.

hoveron.name: flaglist
hoveron.docString: Do the hover effects highlight individual violins or sample points or the kernel density estimate or any combination of them?

xaxis.name: subplotid
xaxis.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's x coordinates and a 2D cartesian x axis. If *x* (the default value), the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis`. If *x2*, the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis2`, and so on.

yaxis.name: subplotid
yaxis.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's y coordinates and a 2D cartesian y axis. If *y* (the default value), the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis`. If *y2*, the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis2`, and so on.

args.name: visible
args.docString: Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible).

args.name: showlegend
args.docString: Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend.

args.name: legendgroup
args.docString: Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items.

args.name: opacity
args.docString: Sets the opacity of the trace.

args.name: name
args.docString: Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover.

args.name: uid
args.docString: Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions.

args.name: ids
args.docString: Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type.

args.name: customdata
args.docString: Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements

args.name: meta
args.docString: Assigns extra meta information associated with this trace that can be used in various text attributes. Attributes such as trace `name`, graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `rangeselector`, `updatemenues` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. To access the trace `meta` values in an attribute in the same trace, simply use `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` item in question. To access trace `meta` in layout attributes, use `%{data[n[.meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` and `n` is the trace index.

args.name: selectedpoints
args.docString: Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect.

args.name: transform
args.docString: An array of operations that manipulate the trace data, for example filtering or sorting the data arrays.

args.name: uirevision
args.docString: Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.

args.name: x
args.docString: Sets the x coordinates.

args.name: x0
args.docString: Alternate to `x`. Builds a linear space of x coordinates. Use with `dx` where `x0` is the starting coordinate and `dx` the step.

args.name: dx
args.docString: Sets the x coordinate step. See `x0` for more info.

args.name: y
args.docString: Sets the y coordinates.

args.name: y0
args.docString: Alternate to `y`. Builds a linear space of y coordinates. Use with `dy` where `y0` is the starting coordinate and `dy` the step.

args.name: dy
args.docString: Sets the y coordinate step. See `y0` for more info.

args.name: xperiod
args.docString: Only relevant when the axis `type` is *date*. Sets the period positioning in milliseconds or *M<n>* on the x axis. Special values in the form of *M<n>* could be used to declare the number of months. In this case `n` must be a positive integer.

args.name: yperiod
args.docString: Only relevant when the axis `type` is *date*. Sets the period positioning in milliseconds or *M<n>* on the y axis. Special values in the form of *M<n>* could be used to declare the number of months. In this case `n` must be a positive integer.

args.name: xperiod0
args.docString: Only relevant when the axis `type` is *date*. Sets the base for period positioning in milliseconds or date string on the x0 axis. When `x0period` is round number of weeks, the `x0period0` by default would be on a Sunday i.e. 2000-01-02, otherwise it would be at 2000-01-01.

args.name: yperiod0
args.docString: Only relevant when the axis `type` is *date*. Sets the base for period positioning in milliseconds or date string on the y0 axis. When `y0period` is round number of weeks, the `y0period0` by default would be on a Sunday i.e. 2000-01-02, otherwise it would be at 2000-01-01.

args.name: xperiodalignment
args.docString: Only relevant when the axis `type` is *date*. Sets the alignment of data points on the x axis.

args.name: yperiodalignment
args.docString: Only relevant when the axis `type` is *date*. Sets the alignment of data points on the y axis.

args.name: hovertext
args.docString: Sets hover text elements associated with each (x,y) pair. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (x,y) coordinates. To be seen, trace `hoverinfo` must contain a *text* flag.

args.name: hovertemplate
args.docString: Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plotly.com/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. variables `percentInitial`, `percentPrevious` and `percentTotal`. Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`.

args.name: hoverinfo
args.docString: Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired.

args.name: textinfo
args.docString: Determines which trace information appear on the graph. In the case of having multiple funnels, percentages & totals are computed separately (per trace).

args.name: texttemplate
args.docString: Template string used for rendering the information text that appear on points. Note that this will override `textinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. Every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. variables `percentInitial`, `percentPrevious`, `percentTotal`, `label` and `value`.

args.name: text
args.docString: Sets text elements associated with each (x,y) pair. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (x,y) coordinates. If trace `hoverinfo` contains a *text* flag and *hovertext* is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels.

args.name: textposition
args.docString: Specifies the location of the `text`. *inside* positions `text` inside, next to the bar end (rotated and scaled if needed). *outside* positions `text` outside, next to the bar end (scaled if needed), unless there is another bar stacked on this one, then the text gets pushed inside. *auto* tries to position `text` inside the bar, but if the bar is too small and no bar is stacked on this one the text is moved outside.

args.name: insidetextanchor
args.docString: Determines if texts are kept at center or start/end points in `textposition` *inside* mode.

args.name: textangle
args.docString: Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the bar. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically. With *auto* the texts may automatically be rotated to fit with the maximum size in bars.

args.name: textfont
args.docString: Sets the font used for `text`.

args.name: insidetextfont
args.docString: Sets the font used for `text` lying inside the bar.

args.name: outsidetextfont
args.docString: Sets the font used for `text` lying outside the bar.

args.name: constraintext
args.docString: Constrain the size of text inside or outside a bar to be no larger than the bar itself.

args.name: cliponaxis
args.docString: Determines whether the text nodes are clipped about the subplot axes. To show the text nodes above axis lines and tick labels, make sure to set `xaxis.layer` and `yaxis.layer` to *below traces*.

args.name: orientation
args.docString: Sets the orientation of the funnels. With *v* (*h*), the value of the each bar spans along the vertical (horizontal). By default funnels are tend to be oriented horizontally; unless only *y* array is presented or orientation is set to *v*. Also regarding graphs including only 'horizontal' funnels, *autorange* on the *y-axis* are set to *reversed*.

args.name: offset
args.docString: Shifts the position where the bar is drawn (in position axis units). In *group* barmode, traces that set *offset* will be excluded and drawn in *overlay* mode instead.

args.name: width
args.docString: Sets the bar width (in position axis units).

args.name: offsetgroup
args.docString: Set several traces linked to the same position axis or matching axes to the same offsetgroup where bars of the same position coordinate will line up.

args.name: alignmentgroup
args.docString: Set several traces linked to the same position axis or matching axes to the same alignmentgroup. This controls whether bars compute their positional range dependently or independently.

args.name: xaxis
args.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's x coordinates and a 2D cartesian x axis. If *x* (the default value), the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis`. If *x2*, the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis2`, and so on.

args.name: yaxis
args.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's y coordinates and a 2D cartesian y axis. If *y* (the default value), the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis`. If *y2*, the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis2`, and so on.

y0.name: any
y0.docString: Alternate to `y`. Builds a linear space of y coordinates. Use with `dy` where `y0` is the starting coordinate and `dy` the step.

dy.name: number
dy.docString: Sets the y coordinate step. See `y0` for more info.

xperiod.name: any
xperiod.docString: Only relevant when the axis `type` is *date*. Sets the period positioning in milliseconds or *M<n>* on the x axis. Special values in the form of *M<n>* could be used to declare the number of months. In this case `n` must be a positive integer.

yperiod.name: any
yperiod.docString: Only relevant when the axis `type` is *date*. Sets the period positioning in milliseconds or *M<n>* on the y axis. Special values in the form of *M<n>* could be used to declare the number of months. In this case `n` must be a positive integer.

xperiod0.name: any
xperiod0.docString: Only relevant when the axis `type` is *date*. Sets the base for period positioning in milliseconds or date string on the x0 axis. When `x0period` is round number of weeks, the `x0period0` by default would be on a Sunday i.e. 2000-01-02, otherwise it would be at 2000-01-01.

yperiod0.name: any
yperiod0.docString: Only relevant when the axis `type` is *date*. Sets the base for period positioning in milliseconds or date string on the y0 axis. When `y0period` is round number of weeks, the `y0period0` by default would be on a Sunday i.e. 2000-01-02, otherwise it would be at 2000-01-01.

xperiodalignment.name: enumerated
xperiodalignment.docString: Only relevant when the axis `type` is *date*. Sets the alignment of data points on the x axis.

yperiodalignment.name: enumerated
yperiodalignment.docString: Only relevant when the axis `type` is *date*. Sets the alignment of data points on the y axis.

hovertext.name: string
hovertext.docString: Sets hover text elements associated with each (x,y) pair. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (x,y) coordinates. To be seen, trace `hoverinfo` must contain a *text* flag.

hovertemplate.name: string
hovertemplate.docString: Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plotly.com/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. variables `percentInitial`, `percentPrevious` and `percentTotal`. Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`.

hoverinfo.name: flaglist
hoverinfo.docString: Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired.

textinfo.name: flaglist
textinfo.docString: Determines which trace information appear on the graph. In the case of having multiple funnels, percentages & totals are computed separately (per trace).

texttemplate.name: string
texttemplate.docString: Template string used for rendering the information text that appear on points. Note that this will override `textinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. Every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. variables `percentInitial`, `percentPrevious`, `percentTotal`, `label` and `value`.

text.name: string
text.docString: Sets text elements associated with each (x,y) pair. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (x,y) coordinates. If trace `hoverinfo` contains a *text* flag and *hovertext* is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels.

textposition.name: enumerated
textposition.docString: Specifies the location of the `text`. *inside* positions `text` inside, next to the bar end (rotated and scaled if needed). *outside* positions `text` outside, next to the bar end (scaled if needed), unless there is another bar stacked on this one, then the text gets pushed inside. *auto* tries to position `text` inside the bar, but if the bar is too small and no bar is stacked on this one the text is moved outside.

insidetextanchor.name: enumerated
insidetextanchor.docString: Determines if texts are kept at center or start/end points in `textposition` *inside* mode.

textangle.name: angle
textangle.docString: Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the bar. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically. With *auto* the texts may automatically be rotated to fit with the maximum size in bars.

constraintext.name: enumerated
constraintext.docString: Constrain the size of text inside or outside a bar to be no larger than the bar itself.

cliponaxis.name: boolean
cliponaxis.docString: Determines whether the text nodes are clipped about the subplot axes. To show the text nodes above axis lines and tick labels, make sure to set `xaxis.layer` and `yaxis.layer` to *below traces*.

orientation.name: enumerated
orientation.docString: Sets the orientation of the funnels. With *v* (*h*), the value of the each bar spans along the vertical (horizontal). By default funnels are tend to be oriented horizontally; unless only *y* array is presented or orientation is set to *v*. Also regarding graphs including only 'horizontal' funnels, *autorange* on the *y-axis* are set to *reversed*.

offset.name: number
offset.docString: Shifts the position where the bar is drawn (in position axis units). In *group* barmode, traces that set *offset* will be excluded and drawn in *overlay* mode instead.

width.name: number
width.docString: Sets the bar width (in position axis units).

offsetgroup.name: string
offsetgroup.docString: Set several traces linked to the same position axis or matching axes to the same offsetgroup where bars of the same position coordinate will line up.

alignmentgroup.name: string
alignmentgroup.docString: Set several traces linked to the same position axis or matching axes to the same alignmentgroup. This controls whether bars compute their positional range dependently or independently.

xaxis.name: subplotid
xaxis.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's x coordinates and a 2D cartesian x axis. If *x* (the default value), the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis`. If *x2*, the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis2`, and so on.

yaxis.name: subplotid
yaxis.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's y coordinates and a 2D cartesian y axis. If *y* (the default value), the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis`. If *y2*, the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis2`, and so on.

idssrc.name: string
idssrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  ids .

customdatasrc.name: string
customdatasrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  customdata .

metasrc.name: string
metasrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  meta .

xsrc.name: string
xsrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  x .

ysrc.name: string
ysrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  y .

hovertextsrc.name: string
hovertextsrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  hovertext .

hovertemplatesrc.name: string
hovertemplatesrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  hovertemplate .

hoverinfosrc.name: string
hoverinfosrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  hoverinfo .

texttemplatesrc.name: string
texttemplatesrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  texttemplate .

textsrc.name: string
textsrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  text .

textpositionsrc.name: string
textpositionsrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  textposition .

args.name: visible
args.docString: Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible).

args.name: showlegend
args.docString: Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend.

args.name: legendgroup
args.docString: Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items.

args.name: opacity
args.docString: Sets the opacity of the trace.

args.name: name
args.docString: Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover.

args.name: uid
args.docString: Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions.

args.name: ids
args.docString: Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type.

args.name: customdata
args.docString: Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements

args.name: meta
args.docString: Assigns extra meta information associated with this trace that can be used in various text attributes. Attributes such as trace `name`, graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `rangeselector`, `updatemenues` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. To access the trace `meta` values in an attribute in the same trace, simply use `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` item in question. To access trace `meta` in layout attributes, use `%{data[n[.meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` and `n` is the trace index.

args.name: selectedpoints
args.docString: Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect.

args.name: transform
args.docString: An array of operations that manipulate the trace data, for example filtering or sorting the data arrays.

args.name: uirevision
args.docString: Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.

args.name: measure
args.docString: An array containing types of values. By default the values are considered as 'relative'. However; it is possible to use 'total' to compute the sums. Also 'absolute' could be applied to reset the computed total or to declare an initial value where needed.

args.name: base
args.docString: Sets where the bar base is drawn (in position axis units).

args.name: x
args.docString: Sets the x coordinates.

args.name: x0
args.docString: Alternate to `x`. Builds a linear space of x coordinates. Use with `dx` where `x0` is the starting coordinate and `dx` the step.

args.name: dx
args.docString: Sets the x coordinate step. See `x0` for more info.

args.name: y
args.docString: Sets the y coordinates.

args.name: y0
args.docString: Alternate to `y`. Builds a linear space of y coordinates. Use with `dy` where `y0` is the starting coordinate and `dy` the step.

args.name: dy
args.docString: Sets the y coordinate step. See `y0` for more info.

args.name: xperiod
args.docString: Only relevant when the axis `type` is *date*. Sets the period positioning in milliseconds or *M<n>* on the x axis. Special values in the form of *M<n>* could be used to declare the number of months. In this case `n` must be a positive integer.

args.name: yperiod
args.docString: Only relevant when the axis `type` is *date*. Sets the period positioning in milliseconds or *M<n>* on the y axis. Special values in the form of *M<n>* could be used to declare the number of months. In this case `n` must be a positive integer.

args.name: xperiod0
args.docString: Only relevant when the axis `type` is *date*. Sets the base for period positioning in milliseconds or date string on the x0 axis. When `x0period` is round number of weeks, the `x0period0` by default would be on a Sunday i.e. 2000-01-02, otherwise it would be at 2000-01-01.

args.name: xperiodalignment
args.docString: Only relevant when the axis `type` is *date*. Sets the alignment of data points on the x axis.

args.name: yperiodalignment
args.docString: Only relevant when the axis `type` is *date*. Sets the alignment of data points on the y axis.

args.name: textangle
args.docString: Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the bar. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically. With *auto* the texts may automatically be rotated to fit with the maximum size in bars.

args.name: textfont
args.docString: Sets the font used for `text`.

args.name: insidetextfont
args.docString: Sets the font used for `text` lying inside the bar.

args.name: outsidetextfont
args.docString: Sets the font used for `text` lying outside the bar.

args.name: constraintext
args.docString: Constrain the size of text inside or outside a bar to be no larger than the bar itself.

args.name: cliponaxis
args.docString: Determines whether the text nodes are clipped about the subplot axes. To show the text nodes above axis lines and tick labels, make sure to set `xaxis.layer` and `yaxis.layer` to *below traces*.

args.docString: Sets the orientation of the bars. With *v* (*h*), the value of the each bar spans along the vertical (horizontal).

args.name: yaxis

Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. Every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. variables `initial`, `delta`, `final` and `label`.

text.name: string
text.docString: Sets text elements associated with each (x,y) pair. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (x,y) coordinates. If trace `hoverinfo` contains a *text* flag and *hovertext* is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels.

textposition.name: enumerated
textposition.docString: Specifies the location of the `text`. *inside* positions `text` inside, next to the bar end (rotated and scaled if needed). *outside* positions `text` outside, next to the bar end (scaled if needed), unless there is another bar stacked on this one, then the text gets pushed inside. *auto* tries to position `text` inside the bar, but if the bar is too small and no bar is stacked on this one the text is moved outside.

insidetextanchor.name: enumerated
insidetextanchor.docString: Determines if texts are kept at center or start/end points in `textposition` *inside* mode.

textangle.name: angle
textangle.docString: Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the bar. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically. With *auto* the texts may automatically be rotated to fit with the maximum size in bars.

constraintext.name: enumerated
constraintext.docString: Constrain the size of text inside or outside a bar to be no larger than the bar itself.

cliponaxis.name: boolean
cliponaxis.docString: Determines whether the text nodes are clipped about the subplot axes. To show the text nodes above axis lines and tick labels, make sure to set `xaxis.layer` and `yaxis.layer` to *below traces*.

orientation.name: enumerated
orientation.docString: Sets the orientation of the bars. With *v* (*h*), the value of the each bar spans along the vertical (horizontal).

offset.name: number
offset.docString: Shifts the position where the bar is drawn (in position axis units). In *group* barmode, traces that set *offset* will be excluded and drawn in *overlay* mode instead.

width.name: number
width.docString: Sets the bar width (in position axis units).

offsetgroup.name: string
offsetgroup.docString: Set several traces linked to the same position axis or matching axes to the same offsetgroup where bars of the same position coordinate will line up.

alignmentgroup.name: string
alignmentgroup.docString: Set several traces linked to the same position axis or matching axes to the same alignmentgroup. This controls whether bars compute their positional range dependently or independently.

xaxis.name: subplotid
xaxis.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's x coordinates and a 2D cartesian x axis. If *x* (the default value), the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis`. If *x2*, the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis2`, and so on.

yaxis.name: subplotid
yaxis.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's y coordinates and a 2D cartesian y axis. If *y* (the default value), the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis`. If *y2*, the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis2`, and so on.

args.name: visible
args.docString: Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible).

args.name: opacity
args.docString: Sets the opacity of the trace.

args.name: name
args.docString: Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover.

args.name: uid
args.docString: Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions.

args.name: ids
args.docString: Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type.

args.name: customdata
args.docString: Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements

args.name: meta
args.docString: Assigns extra meta information associated with this trace that can be used in various text attributes. Attributes such as trace `name`, graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `rangeselector`, `updatemenues` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. To access the trace `meta` values in an attribute in the same trace, simply use `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` item in question. To access trace `meta` in layout attributes, use `%{data[n[.meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` and `n` is the trace index.

args.name: uirevision
args.docString: Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.

args.name: source
args.docString: Specifies the data URI of the image to be visualized. The URI consists of "data:image/[<media subtype>][;base64],<data>"

args.name: z
args.docString: A 2-dimensional array in which each element is an array of 3 or 4 numbers representing a color.

args.name: colormodel
args.docString: Color model used to map the numerical color components described in `z` into colors. If `source` is specified, this attribute will be set to `rgba256` otherwise it defaults to `rgb`.

args.name: zsmooth
args.docString: Picks a smoothing algorithm used to smooth `z` data. This only applies for image traces that use the `source` attribute.

args.name: zmin
args.docString: Array defining the lower bound for each color component. Note that the default value will depend on the colormodel. For the `rgb` colormodel, it is [0, 0, 0]. For the `rgba` colormodel, it is [0, 0, 0, 0]. For the `rgba256` colormodel, it is [0, 0, 0, 0]. For the `hsl` colormodel, it is [0, 0, 0]. For the `hsla` colormodel, it is [0, 0, 0, 0].

args.name: zmax
args.docString: Array defining the higher bound for each color component. Note that the default value will depend on the colormodel. For the `rgb` colormodel, it is [255, 255, 255]. For the `rgba` colormodel, it is [255, 255, 255, 1]. For the `rgba256` colormodel, it is [255, 255, 255, 255]. For the `hsl` colormodel, it is [360, 100, 100]. For the `hsla` colormodel, it is [360, 100, 100, 1].

args.name: x0
args.docString: Set the image's x position.

args.name: y0
args.docString: Set the image's y position.

args.name: dx
args.docString: Set the pixel's horizontal size.

args.name: dy
args.docString: Set the pixel's vertical size

args.name: text
args.docString: Sets the text elements associated with each z value.

args.name: hovertext
args.docString: Same as `text`.

args.name: hoverinfo
args.docString: Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired.

args.name: hovertemplate
args.docString: Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plotly.com/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. variables `z`, `color` and `colormodel`. Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`.

args.name: xaxis
args.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's x coordinates and a 2D cartesian x axis. If *x* (the default value), the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis`. If *x2*, the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis2`, and so on.

args.name: yaxis
args.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's y coordinates and a 2D cartesian y axis. If *y* (the default value), the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis`. If *y2*, the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis2`, and so on.

args.name: visible
args.docString: Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible).

args.name: showlegend
args.docString: Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend.

args.name: legendgroup
args.docString: Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items.

args.name: opacity
args.docString: Sets the opacity of the trace.

args.name: name
args.docString: Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover.

args.name: uid
args.docString: Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions.

args.name: ids
args.docString: Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type.

args.name: customdata
args.docString: Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements

args.name: meta
args.docString: Assigns extra meta information associated with this trace that can be used in various text attributes. Attributes such as trace `name`, graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `rangeselector`, `updatemenues` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. To access the trace `meta` values in an attribute in the same trace, simply use `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` item in question. To access trace `meta` in layout attributes, use `%{data[n[.meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` and `n` is the trace index.

args.name: transform
args.docString: An array of operations that manipulate the trace data, for example filtering or sorting the data arrays.

args.name: uirevision
args.docString: Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.

args.name: labels
args.docString: Sets the sector labels. If `labels` entries are duplicated, we sum associated `values` or simply count occurrences if `values` is not provided. For other array attributes (including color) we use the first non-empty entry among all occurrences of the label.

args.name: label0
args.docString: Alternate to `labels`. Builds a numeric set of labels. Use with `dlabel` where `label0` is the starting label and `dlabel` the step.

args.name: dlabel
args.docString: Sets the label step. See `label0` for more info.

args.name: values
args.docString: Sets the values of the sectors. If omitted, we count occurrences of each label.

args.name: text
args.docString: Sets text elements associated with each sector. If trace `textinfo` contains a *text* flag, these elements will be seen on the chart. If trace `hoverinfo` contains a *text* flag and *hovertext* is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels.

args.name: hovertext
args.docString: Sets hover text elements associated with each sector. If a single string, the same string appears for all data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order of this trace's sectors. To be seen, trace `hoverinfo` must contain a *text* flag.

args.name: scalegroup
args.docString: If there are multiple pie charts that should be sized according to their totals, link them by providing a non-empty group id here shared by every trace in the same group.

args.name: textinfo
args.docString: Determines which trace information appear on the graph.

args.name: hoverinfo
args.docString: Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired.

args.name: hovertemplate
args.docString: Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plotly.com/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. variables `label`, `color`, `value`, `percent` and `text`. Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`.

args.name: texttemplate
args.docString: Template string used for rendering the information text that appear on points. Note that this will override `textinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. Every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. variables `label`, `color`, `value`, `percent` and `text`.

args.name: textposition
args.docString: Specifies the location of the `textinfo`.

args.name: textfont
args.docString: Sets the font used for `textinfo`.

args.name: insidetextorientation
args.docString: Controls the orientation of the text inside chart sectors. When set to *auto*, text may be oriented in any direction in order to be as big as possible in the middle of a sector. The *horizontal* option orients text to be parallel with the bottom of the chart, and may make text smaller in order to achieve that goal. The *radial* option orients text along the radius of the sector. The *tangential* option orients text perpendicular to the radius of the sector.

args.name: insidetextfont
args.docString: Sets the font used for `textinfo` lying inside the sector.

args.name: outsidetextfont
args.docString: Sets the font used for `textinfo` lying outside the sector.

args.name: automargin
args.docString: Determines whether outside text labels can push the margins.

args.name: hole
args.docString: Sets the fraction of the radius to cut out of the pie. Use this to make a donut chart.

args.name: sort
args.docString: Determines whether or not the sectors are reordered from largest to smallest.

args.name: direction
args.docString: Specifies the direction at which succeeding sectors follow one another.

args.name: rotation
args.docString: Instead of the first slice starting at 12 o'clock, rotate to some other angle.

args.name: pull
args.docString: Sets the fraction of larger radius to pull the sectors out from the center. This can be a constant to pull all slices apart from each other equally or an array to highlight one or more slices.

opacity.docString: Sets the opacity of the trace.

name.name: string
name.docString: Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover.

uid.name: string
uid.docString: Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions.

ids.name: data_array
ids.docString: Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type.

customdata.name: data_array
customdata.docString: Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements

meta.name: any
meta.docString: Assigns extra meta information associated with this trace that can be used in various text attributes. Attributes such as trace `name`, graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `rangeselector`, `updatemenues` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. To access the trace `meta` values in an attribute in the same trace, simply use `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` item in question. To access trace `meta` in layout attributes, use `%{data[n[.meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` and `n` is the trace index.

uirevision.name: any
uirevision.docString: Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.

labels.name: data_array
labels.docString: Sets the sector labels. If `labels` entries are duplicated, we sum associated `values` or simply count occurrences if `values` is not provided. For other array attributes (including color) we use the first non-empty entry among all occurrences of the label.

label0.name: number
label0.docString: Alternate to `labels`. Builds a numeric set of labels. Use with `dlabel` where `label0` is the starting label and `dlabel` the step.

dlabel.name: number
dlabel.docString: Sets the label step. See `label0` for more info.

values.name: data_array
values.docString: Sets the values of the sectors. If omitted, we count occurrences of each label.

text.name: data_array
text.docString: Sets text elements associated with each sector. If trace `textinfo` contains a *text* flag, these elements will be seen on the chart. If trace `hoverinfo` contains a *text* flag and *hovertext* is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels.

hovertext.name: string
hovertext.docString: Sets hover text elements associated with each sector. If a single string, the same string appears for all data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order of this trace's sectors. To be seen, trace `hoverinfo` must contain a *text* flag.

scalegroup.name: string
scalegroup.docString: If there are multiple pie charts that should be sized according to their totals, link them by providing a non-empty group id here shared by every trace in the same group.

textinfo.name: flaglist
textinfo.docString: Determines which trace information appear on the graph.

hoverinfo.name: flaglist
hoverinfo.docString: Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired.

hovertemplate.name: string
hovertemplate.docString: Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plotly.com/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. variables `label`, `color`, `value`, `percent` and `text`. Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`.

texttemplate.name: string
texttemplate.docString: Template string used for rendering the information text that appear on points. Note that this will override `textinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. Every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. variables `label`, `color`, `value`, `percent` and `text`.

insidetextorientation.name: enumerated
insidetextorientation.docString: Controls the orientation of the text inside chart sectors. When set to *auto*, text may be oriented in any direction in order to be as big as possible in the middle of a sector. The *horizontal* option orients text to be parallel with the bottom of the chart, and may make text smaller in order to achieve that goal. The *radial* option orients text along the radius of the sector. The *tangential* option orients text perpendicular to the radius of the sector.

automargin.name: boolean
automargin.docString: Determines whether outside text labels can push the margins.

hole.name: number
hole.docString: Sets the fraction of the radius to cut out of the pie. Use this to make a donut chart.

sort.name: boolean
sort.docString: Determines whether or not the sectors are reordered from largest to smallest.

direction.name: enumerated
direction.docString: Specifies the direction at which succeeding sectors follow one another.

rotation.name: number
rotation.docString: Instead of the first slice starting at 12 o'clock, rotate to some other angle.

pull.name: number
pull.docString: Sets the fraction of larger radius to pull the sectors out from the center. This can be a constant to pull all slices apart from each other equally or an array to highlight one or more slices.

idssrc.name: string
idssrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  ids .

customdatasrc.name: string
customdatasrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  customdata .

metasrc.name: string
metasrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  meta .

labelssrc.name: string
labelssrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  labels .

valuessrc.name: string
valuessrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  values .

textsrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  text .

hovertextsrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  hovertext .

hoverinfosrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  hoverinfo .

hovertemplatesrc.name: string
hovertemplatesrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  hovertemplate .

texttemplatesrc.name: string
texttemplatesrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  texttemplate .

textpositionsrc.name: string
textpositionsrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  textposition .

pullsrc.name: string
pullsrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  pull .

args.name: visible
args.docString: Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible).

args.name: opacity
args.docString: Sets the opacity of the trace.

args.name: name
args.docString: Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover.

args.name: uid
args.docString: Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions.

args.name: ids
args.docString: Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type.

args.name: customdata
args.docString: Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements

args.name: meta
args.docString: Assigns extra meta information associated with this trace that can be used in various text attributes. Attributes such as trace `name`, graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `rangeselector`, `updatemenues` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. To access the trace `meta` values in an attribute in the same trace, simply use `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` item in question. To access trace `meta` in layout attributes, use `%{data[n[.meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` and `n` is the trace index.

args.name: transform
args.docString: An array of operations that manipulate the trace data, for example filtering or sorting the data arrays.

args.name: uirevision
args.docString: Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.

args.name: labels
args.docString: Sets the labels of each of the sectors.

args.name: parents
args.docString: Sets the parent sectors for each of the sectors. Empty string items '' are understood to reference the root node in the hierarchy. If `ids` is filled, `parents` items are understood to be "ids" themselves. When `ids` is not set, plotly attempts to find matching items in `labels`, but beware they must be unique.

args.name: values
args.docString: Sets the values associated with each of the sectors. Use with `branchvalues` to determine how the values are summed.

args.name: branchvalues
args.docString: Determines how the items in `values` are summed. When set to *total*, items in `values` are taken to be value of all its descendants. When set to *remainder*, items in `values` corresponding to the root and the branches sectors are taken to be the extra part not part of the sum of the values at their leaves.

args.name: count
args.docString: Determines default for `values` when it is not provided, by inferring a 1 for each of the *leaves* and/or *branches*, otherwise 0.

args.name: level
args.docString: Sets the level from which this trace hierarchy is rendered. Set `level` to `''` to start from the root node in the hierarchy. Must be an "id" if `ids` is filled in, otherwise plotly attempts to find a matching item in `labels`.

args.name: maxdepth
args.docString: Sets the number of rendered sectors from any given `level`. Set `maxdepth` to *-1* to render all the levels in the hierarchy.

args.name: text
args.docString: Sets text elements associated with each sector. If trace `textinfo` contains a *text* flag, these elements will be seen on the chart. If trace `hoverinfo` contains a *text* flag and *hovertext* is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels.

args.name: textinfo
args.docString: Determines which trace information appear on the graph.

args.name: texttemplate
args.docString: Template string used for rendering the information text that appear on points. Note that this will override `textinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. Every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. variables `currentPath`, `root`, `entry`, `percentRoot`, `percentEntry`, `percentParent`, `label` and `value`.

args.name: hovertext
args.docString: Sets hover text elements associated with each sector. If a single string, the same string appears for all data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order of this trace's sectors. To be seen, trace `hoverinfo` must contain a *text* flag.

args.name: hoverinfo
args.docString: Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired.

args.name: hovertemplate
args.docString: Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plotly.com/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. variables `currentPath`, `root`, `entry`, `percentRoot`, `percentEntry` and `percentParent`. Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`.

args.name: textfont
args.docString: Sets the font used for `textinfo`.

args.name: insidetextorientation
args.docString: Controls the orientation of the text inside chart sectors. When set to *auto*, text may be oriented in any direction in order to be as big as possible in the middle of a sector. The *horizontal* option orients text to be parallel with the bottom of the chart, and may make text smaller in order to achieve that goal. The *radial* option orients text along the radius of the sector. The *tangential* option orients text perpendicular to the radius of the sector.

args.name: insidetextfont
args.docString: Sets the font used for `textinfo` lying inside the sector.

args.name: outsidetextfont
args.docString: Sets the font used for `textinfo` lying outside the sector. This option refers to the root of the hierarchy presented at the center of a sunburst graph. Please note that if a hierarchy has multiple root nodes, this option won't have any effect and `insidetextfont` would be used.

args.name: rotation
args.docString: Rotates the whole diagram counterclockwise by some angle. By default the first slice starts at 3 o'clock.

args.name: sort
args.docString: Determines whether or not the sectors are reordered from largest to smallest.

args.name: values
args.docString: Sets the values associated with each of the sectors. Use with `branchvalues` to determine how the values are summed.

args.name: branchvalues
args.docString: Determines how the items in `values` are summed. When set to *total*, items in `values` are taken to be value of all its descendants. When set to *remainder*, items in `values` corresponding to the root and the branches sectors are taken to be the extra part not part of the sum of the values at their leaves.

args.name: count
args.docString: Determines default for `values` when it is not provided, by inferring a 1 for each of the *leaves* and/or *branches*, otherwise 0.

args.name: level
args.docString: Sets the level from which this trace hierarchy is rendered. Set `level` to `''` to start from the root node in the hierarchy. Must be an "id" if `ids` is filled in, otherwise plotly attempts to find a matching item in `labels`.

args.name: maxdepth
args.docString: Sets the number of rendered sectors from any given `level`. Set `maxdepth` to *-1* to render all the levels in the hierarchy.

args.name: text
args.docString: Sets text elements associated with each sector. If trace `textinfo` contains a *text* flag, these elements will be seen on the chart. If trace `hoverinfo` contains a *text* flag and *hovertext* is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels.

args.name: textinfo
args.docString: Determines which trace information appear on the graph.

args.name: texttemplate
args.docString: Template string used for rendering the information text that appear on points. Note that this will override `textinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. Every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. variables `currentPath`, `root`, `entry`, `percentRoot`, `percentEntry`, `percentParent`, `label` and `value`.

args.name: hovertext
args.docString: Sets hover text elements associated with each sector. If a single string, the same string appears for all data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order of this trace's sectors. To be seen, trace `hoverinfo` must contain a *text* flag.

args.name: hoverinfo
args.docString: Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired.

args.name: hovertemplate
args.docString: Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plotly.com/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. variables `currentPath`, `root`, `entry`, `percentRoot`, `percentEntry` and `percentParent`. Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`.

args.name: textfont
args.docString: Sets the font used for `textinfo`.

args.name: insidetextfont
args.docString: Sets the font used for `textinfo` lying inside the sector.

args.name: outsidetextfont
args.docString: Sets the font used for `textinfo` lying outside the sector. This option refers to the root of the hierarchy presented on top left corner of a treemap graph. Please note that if a hierarchy has multiple root nodes, this option won't have any effect and `insidetextfont` would be used.

args.name: textposition
args.docString: Sets the positions of the `text` elements.

args.name: sort
args.docString: Determines whether or not the sectors are reordered from largest to smallest.

opacity.name: number
opacity.docString: Sets the opacity of the trace.

uid.name: string

ids.name: data_array

meta.name: any
meta.docString: Assigns extra meta information associated with this trace that can be used in various text attributes. Attributes such as trace `name`, graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `rangeselector`, `updatemenues` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. To access the trace `meta` values in an attribute in the same trace, simply use `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` item in question. To access trace `meta` in layout attributes, use `%{data[n[.meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` and `n` is the trace index.

uirevision.name: any

Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.
