visible.name: enumerated
visible.docString: Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible).

showlegend.name: boolean
showlegend.docString: Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend.

legendgroup.name: string
legendgroup.docString: Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items.

opacity.name: number
opacity.docString: Sets the opacity of the trace.

name.name: string
name.docString: Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover.

uid.name: string
uid.docString: Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions.

ids.name: data_array
ids.docString: Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type.

customdata.name: data_array
customdata.docString: Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements

meta.name: any
meta.docString: Assigns extra meta information associated with this trace that can be used in various text attributes. Attributes such as trace `name`, graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `rangeselector`, `updatemenues` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. To access the trace `meta` values in an attribute in the same trace, simply use `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` item in question. To access trace `meta` in layout attributes, use `%{data[n[.meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` and `n` is the trace index.

selectedpoints.name: any
selectedpoints.docString: Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect.

uirevision.name: any
uirevision.docString: Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.

args.name: visible
args.docString: Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible).

args.name: legendgroup
args.docString: Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items.

args.name: name
args.docString: Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover.

args.name: uid
args.docString: Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions.

args.name: ids
args.docString: Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type.

args.name: customdata
args.docString: Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements

args.name: meta
args.docString: Assigns extra meta information associated with this trace that can be used in various text attributes. Attributes such as trace `name`, graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `rangeselector`, `updatemenues` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. To access the trace `meta` values in an attribute in the same trace, simply use `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` item in question. To access trace `meta` in layout attributes, use `%{data[n[.meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` and `n` is the trace index.

args.name: selectedpoints
args.docString: Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect.

args.name: transform
args.docString: An array of operations that manipulate the trace data, for example filtering or sorting the data arrays.

args.name: uirevision
args.docString: Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.

args.name: locations
args.docString: Sets the coordinates via location IDs or names. See `locationmode` for more info.

args.name: locationmode
args.docString: Determines the set of locations used to match entries in `locations` to regions on the map. Values *ISO-3*, *USA-states*, *country names* correspond to features on the base map and value *geojson-id* corresponds to features from a custom GeoJSON linked to the `geojson` attribute.

args.name: z
args.docString: Sets the color values.

args.name: geojson
args.docString: Sets optional GeoJSON data associated with this trace. If not given, the features on the base map are used. It can be set as a valid GeoJSON object or as a URL string. Note that we only accept GeoJSONs of type *FeatureCollection* or *Feature* with geometries of type *Polygon* or *MultiPolygon*.

args.name: featureidkey
args.docString: Sets the key in GeoJSON features which is used as id to match the items included in the `locations` array. Only has an effect when `geojson` is set. Support nested property, for example *properties.name*.

args.name: text
args.docString: Sets the text elements associated with each location.

args.name: hovertext
args.docString: Same as `text`.

args.name: hoverinfo
args.docString: Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired.

args.name: hovertemplate
args.docString: Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plotly.com/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available.  Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`.

args.name: showlegend
args.docString: Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend.

args.name: zauto
args.docString: Determines whether or not the color domain is computed with respect to the input data (here in `z`) or the bounds set in `zmin` and `zmax`  Defaults to `false` when `zmin` and `zmax` are set by the user.

args.name: zmin
args.docString: Sets the lower bound of the color domain. Value should have the same units as in `z` and if set, `zmax` must be set as well.

args.name: zmax
args.docString: Sets the upper bound of the color domain. Value should have the same units as in `z` and if set, `zmin` must be set as well.

args.name: zmid
args.docString: Sets the mid-point of the color domain by scaling `zmin` and/or `zmax` to be equidistant to this point. Value should have the same units as in `z`. Has no effect when `zauto` is `false`.

args.name: colorscale
args.docString: Sets the colorscale. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)'], [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use`zmin` and `zmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys,YlGnBu,Greens,YlOrRd,Bluered,RdBu,Reds,Blues,Picnic,Rainbow,Portland,Jet,Hot,Blackbody,Earth,Electric,Viridis,Cividis.

args.name: autocolorscale
args.docString: Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette (`autocolorscale: true`) or the palette determined by `colorscale`. In case `colorscale` is unspecified or `autocolorscale` is true, the default  palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the `color` array are all positive, all negative or mixed.

args.name: reversescale
args.docString: Reverses the color mapping if true. If true, `zmin` will correspond to the last color in the array and `zmax` will correspond to the first color.

args.name: showscale
args.docString: Determines whether or not a colorbar is displayed for this trace.

args.name: coloraxis
args.docString: Sets a reference to a shared color axis. References to these shared color axes are *coloraxis*, *coloraxis2*, *coloraxis3*, etc. Settings for these shared color axes are set in the layout, under `layout.coloraxis`, `layout.coloraxis2`, etc. Note that multiple color scales can be linked to the same color axis.

args.name: geo
args.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's geospatial coordinates and a geographic map. If *geo* (the default value), the geospatial coordinates refer to `layout.geo`. If *geo2*, the geospatial coordinates refer to `layout.geo2`, and so on.

locationmode.name: enumerated
locationmode.docString: Determines the set of locations used to match entries in `locations` to regions on the map. Values *ISO-3*, *USA-states*, *country names* correspond to features on the base map and value *geojson-id* corresponds to features from a custom GeoJSON linked to the `geojson` attribute.

z.name: data_array
z.docString: Sets the color values.

geojson.name: any
geojson.docString: Sets optional GeoJSON data associated with this trace. If not given, the features on the base map are used. It can be set as a valid GeoJSON object or as a URL string. Note that we only accept GeoJSONs of type *FeatureCollection* or *Feature* with geometries of type *Polygon* or *MultiPolygon*.

featureidkey.name: string
featureidkey.docString: Sets the key in GeoJSON features which is used as id to match the items included in the `locations` array. Only has an effect when `geojson` is set. Support nested property, for example *properties.name*.

text.name: string
text.docString: Sets the text elements associated with each location.

hovertext.name: string
hovertext.docString: Same as `text`.

hoverinfo.name: flaglist
hoverinfo.docString: Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired.

hovertemplate.name: string
hovertemplate.docString: Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plotly.com/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available.  Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`.

showlegend.name: boolean
showlegend.docString: Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend.

zauto.name: boolean
zauto.docString: Determines whether or not the color domain is computed with respect to the input data (here in `z`) or the bounds set in `zmin` and `zmax`  Defaults to `false` when `zmin` and `zmax` are set by the user.

zmin.name: number
zmin.docString: Sets the lower bound of the color domain. Value should have the same units as in `z` and if set, `zmax` must be set as well.

zmax.name: number
zmax.docString: Sets the upper bound of the color domain. Value should have the same units as in `z` and if set, `zmin` must be set as well.

zmid.name: number
zmid.docString: Sets the mid-point of the color domain by scaling `zmin` and/or `zmax` to be equidistant to this point. Value should have the same units as in `z`. Has no effect when `zauto` is `false`.

colorscale.name: colorscale
colorscale.docString: Sets the colorscale. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)'], [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use`zmin` and `zmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys,YlGnBu,Greens,YlOrRd,Bluered,RdBu,Reds,Blues,Picnic,Rainbow,Portland,Jet,Hot,Blackbody,Earth,Electric,Viridis,Cividis.

autocolorscale.name: boolean
autocolorscale.docString: Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette (`autocolorscale: true`) or the palette determined by `colorscale`. In case `colorscale` is unspecified or `autocolorscale` is true, the default  palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the `color` array are all positive, all negative or mixed.

reversescale.name: boolean
reversescale.docString: Reverses the color mapping if true. If true, `zmin` will correspond to the last color in the array and `zmax` will correspond to the first color.

showscale.name: boolean
showscale.docString: Determines whether or not a colorbar is displayed for this trace.

coloraxis.name: subplotid
coloraxis.docString: Sets a reference to a shared color axis. References to these shared color axes are *coloraxis*, *coloraxis2*, *coloraxis3*, etc. Settings for these shared color axes are set in the layout, under `layout.coloraxis`, `layout.coloraxis2`, etc. Note that multiple color scales can be linked to the same color axis.

geo.name: subplotid
geo.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's geospatial coordinates and a geographic map. If *geo* (the default value), the geospatial coordinates refer to `layout.geo`. If *geo2*, the geospatial coordinates refer to `layout.geo2`, and so on.

idssrc.name: string
idssrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  ids .

customdatasrc.name: string
customdatasrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  customdata .

metasrc.name: string
metasrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  meta .

locationssrc.name: string
locationssrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  locations .

zsrc.name: string
zsrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  z .

textsrc.name: string
textsrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  text .

hovertextsrc.name: string
hovertextsrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  hovertext .

hoverinfosrc.name: string
hoverinfosrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  hoverinfo .

hovertemplatesrc.name: string
hovertemplatesrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  hovertemplate .

args.name: visible
args.docString: Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible).

args.name: showlegend
args.docString: Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend.

args.name: legendgroup
args.docString: Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items.

args.name: name
args.docString: Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover.

args.name: uid
args.docString: Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions.

args.name: ids
args.docString: Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type.

args.name: customdata
args.docString: Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements

args.name: meta
args.docString: Assigns extra meta information associated with this trace that can be used in various text attributes. Attributes such as trace `name`, graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `rangeselector`, `updatemenues` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. To access the trace `meta` values in an attribute in the same trace, simply use `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` item in question. To access trace `meta` in layout attributes, use `%{data[n[.meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` and `n` is the trace index.

args.name: selectedpoints
args.docString: Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect.

args.name: hoverinfo
args.docString: Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired.

args.name: transform
args.docString: An array of operations that manipulate the trace data, for example filtering or sorting the data arrays.

args.name: uirevision
args.docString: Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.

args.name: x
args.docString: Sets the x coordinates.

args.name: x0
args.docString: Alternate to `x`. Builds a linear space of x coordinates. Use with `dx` where `x0` is the starting coordinate and `dx` the step.

args.name: dx
args.docString: Sets the x coordinate step. See `x0` for more info.

args.name: y
args.docString: Sets the y coordinates.

args.name: y0
args.docString: Alternate to `y`. Builds a linear space of y coordinates. Use with `dy` where `y0` is the starting coordinate and `dy` the step.

args.name: dy
args.docString: Sets the y coordinate step. See `y0` for more info.

args.name: xperiod
args.docString: Only relevant when the axis `type` is *date*. Sets the period positioning in milliseconds or *M<n>* on the x axis. Special values in the form of *M<n>* could be used to declare the number of months. In this case `n` must be a positive integer.

args.name: yperiod
args.docString: Only relevant when the axis `type` is *date*. Sets the period positioning in milliseconds or *M<n>* on the y axis. Special values in the form of *M<n>* could be used to declare the number of months. In this case `n` must be a positive integer.

args.name: xperiod0
args.docString: Only relevant when the axis `type` is *date*. Sets the base for period positioning in milliseconds or date string on the x0 axis. When `x0period` is round number of weeks, the `x0period0` by default would be on a Sunday i.e. 2000-01-02, otherwise it would be at 2000-01-01.

args.name: yperiod0
args.docString: Only relevant when the axis `type` is *date*. Sets the base for period positioning in milliseconds or date string on the y0 axis. When `y0period` is round number of weeks, the `y0period0` by default would be on a Sunday i.e. 2000-01-02, otherwise it would be at 2000-01-01.

args.name: xperiodalignment
args.docString: Only relevant when the axis `type` is *date*. Sets the alignment of data points on the x axis.

args.name: yperiodalignment
args.docString: Only relevant when the axis `type` is *date*. Sets the alignment of data points on the y axis.

args.name: text
args.docString: Sets text elements associated with each (x,y) pair. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (x,y) coordinates. If trace `hoverinfo` contains a *text* flag and *hovertext* is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels.

args.name: hovertext
args.docString: Sets hover text elements associated with each (x,y) pair. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (x,y) coordinates. To be seen, trace `hoverinfo` must contain a *text* flag.

args.name: textposition
args.docString: Sets the positions of the `text` elements with respects to the (x,y) coordinates.

args.name: textfont
args.docString: Sets the text font.

args.name: mode
args.docString: Determines the drawing mode for this scatter trace.

args.name: connectgaps
args.docString: Determines whether or not gaps (i.e. {nan} or missing values) in the provided data arrays are connected.

args.name: fill
args.docString: Sets the area to fill with a solid color. Defaults to *none* unless this trace is stacked, then it gets *tonexty* (*tonextx*) if `orientation` is *v* (*h*) Use with `fillcolor` if not *none*. *tozerox* and *tozeroy* fill to x=0 and y=0 respectively. *tonextx* and *tonexty* fill between the endpoints of this trace and the endpoints of the trace before it, connecting those endpoints with straight lines (to make a stacked area graph); if there is no trace before it, they behave like *tozerox* and *tozeroy*. *toself* connects the endpoints of the trace (or each segment of the trace if it has gaps) into a closed shape. *tonext* fills the space between two traces if one completely encloses the other (eg consecutive contour lines), and behaves like *toself* if there is no trace before it. *tonext* should not be used if one trace does not enclose the other. Traces in a `stackgroup` will only fill to (or be filled to) other traces in the same group. With multiple `stackgroup`s or some traces stacked and some not, if fill-linked traces are not already consecutive, the later ones will be pushed down in the drawing order.

args.name: fillcolor
args.docString: Sets the fill color. Defaults to a half-transparent variant of the line color, marker color, or marker line color, whichever is available.

args.name: opacity
args.docString: Sets the opacity of the trace.

args.name: hovertemplate
args.docString: Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plotly.com/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available.  Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`.

args.name: texttemplate
args.docString: Template string used for rendering the information text that appear on points. Note that this will override `textinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. Every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available.

args.name: xcalendar
args.docString: Sets the calendar system to use with `x` date data.

args.name: ycalendar
args.docString: Sets the calendar system to use with `y` date data.

args.name: xaxis
args.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's x coordinates and a 2D cartesian x axis. If *x* (the default value), the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis`. If *x2*, the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis2`, and so on.

args.name: yaxis
args.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's y coordinates and a 2D cartesian y axis. If *y* (the default value), the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis`. If *y2*, the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis2`, and so on.

args.name: idssrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  ids .

args.name: customdatasrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  customdata .

args.name: metasrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  meta .

args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  hoverinfo .

args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  x .

args.name: texttemplatesrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  texttemplate .

hovertemplatesrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  hovertemplate .

args.name: visible
args.docString: Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible).

args.name: showlegend
args.docString: Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend.

args.name: legendgroup
args.docString: Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items.

args.name: name
args.docString: Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover.

args.name: uid
args.docString: Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions.

args.name: ids
args.docString: Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type.

args.name: customdata
args.docString: Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements

args.name: meta
args.docString: Assigns extra meta information associated with this trace that can be used in various text attributes. Attributes such as trace `name`, graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `rangeselector`, `updatemenues` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. To access the trace `meta` values in an attribute in the same trace, simply use `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` item in question. To access trace `meta` in layout attributes, use `%{data[n[.meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` and `n` is the trace index.

args.name: selectedpoints
args.docString: Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect.

args.name: hoverinfo
args.docString: Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired.

args.name: transform
args.docString: An array of operations that manipulate the trace data, for example filtering or sorting the data arrays.

args.name: uirevision
args.docString: Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.

args.name: text
args.docString: Sets text elements associated with each (x,y) pair to appear on hover. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (x,y) coordinates.

args.name: hovertext
args.docString: Same as `text`.

args.name: hovertemplate
args.docString: Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plotly.com/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available.  Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`.

args.name: xaxes
args.docString: Sets the list of x axes corresponding to dimensions of this splom trace. By default, a splom will match the first N xaxes where N is the number of input dimensions. Note that, in case where `diagonal.visible` is false and `showupperhalf` or `showlowerhalf` is false, this splom trace will generate one less x-axis and one less y-axis.

args.name: yaxes
args.docString: Sets the list of y axes corresponding to dimensions of this splom trace. By default, a splom will match the first N yaxes where N is the number of input dimensions. Note that, in case where `diagonal.visible` is false and `showupperhalf` or `showlowerhalf` is false, this splom trace will generate one less x-axis and one less y-axis.

args.name: showupperhalf
args.docString: Determines whether or not subplots on the upper half from the diagonal are displayed.

args.name: showlowerhalf
args.docString: Determines whether or not subplots on the lower half from the diagonal are displayed.

args.name: opacity
args.docString: Sets the opacity of the trace.

args.name: idssrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  ids .

args.name: customdatasrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  customdata .

args.name: metasrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  meta .

args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  hoverinfo .

args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  text .

args.docString: Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover.

args.name: uid
args.docString: Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions.

args.name: ids
args.docString: Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type.

args.name: customdata
args.docString: Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements

args.name: meta
args.docString: Assigns extra meta information associated with this trace that can be used in various text attributes. Attributes such as trace `name`, graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `rangeselector`, `updatemenues` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. To access the trace `meta` values in an attribute in the same trace, simply use `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` item in question. To access trace `meta` in layout attributes, use `%{data[n[.meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` and `n` is the trace index.

args.name: hoverinfo
args.docString: Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired.

args.name: uirevision
args.docString: Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.

args.name: x
args.docString: Sets the x coordinates.

args.name: y
args.docString: Sets the y coordinates.

args.name: xy
args.docString: Faster alternative to specifying `x` and `y` separately. If supplied, it must be a typed `Float32Array` array that represents points such that `xy[i * 2] = x[i]` and `xy[i * 2 + 1] = y[i]`

args.name: indices
args.docString: A sequential value, 0..n, supply it to avoid creating this array inside plotting. If specified, it must be a typed `Int32Array` array. Its length must be equal to or greater than the number of points. For the best performance and memory use, create one large `indices` typed array that is guaranteed to be at least as long as the largest number of points during use, and reuse it on each `Plotly.restyle()` call.

args.name: xbounds
args.docString: Specify `xbounds` in the shape of `[xMin, xMax] to avoid looping through the `xy` typed array. Use it in conjunction with `xy` and `ybounds` for the performance benefits.

args.name: ybounds
args.docString: Specify `ybounds` in the shape of `[yMin, yMax] to avoid looping through the `xy` typed array. Use it in conjunction with `xy` and `xbounds` for the performance benefits.

args.name: text
args.docString: Sets text elements associated with each (x,y) pair. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (x,y) coordinates. If trace `hoverinfo` contains a *text* flag and *hovertext* is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels.

args.name: xaxis
args.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's x coordinates and a 2D cartesian x axis. If *x* (the default value), the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis`. If *x2*, the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis2`, and so on.

args.name: yaxis
args.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's y coordinates and a 2D cartesian y axis. If *y* (the default value), the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis`. If *y2*, the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis2`, and so on.

args.name: x

args.name: x0
args.docString: Alternate to `x`. Builds a linear space of x coordinates. Use with `dx` where `x0` is the starting coordinate and `dx` the step.

args.name: transpose
args.docString: Transposes the z data.

args.name: xtype
args.docString: If *array*, the heatmap's x coordinates are given by *x* (the default behavior when `x` is provided). If *scaled*, the heatmap's x coordinates are given by *x0* and *dx* (the default behavior when `x` is not provided).

args.name: ytype
args.docString: If *array*, the heatmap's y coordinates are given by *y* (the default behavior when `y` is provided) If *scaled*, the heatmap's y coordinates are given by *y0* and *dy* (the default behavior when `y` is not provided)

args.name: zsmooth
args.docString: Picks a smoothing algorithm use to smooth `z` data.

args.name: zauto
args.docString: Determines whether or not the color domain is computed with respect to the input data (here in `z`) or the bounds set in `zmin` and `zmax`  Defaults to `false` when `zmin` and `zmax` are set by the user.

args.name: zmin
args.docString: Sets the lower bound of the color domain. Value should have the same units as in `z` and if set, `zmax` must be set as well.

args.name: zmax
args.docString: Sets the upper bound of the color domain. Value should have the same units as in `z` and if set, `zmin` must be set as well.

args.name: zmid
args.docString: Sets the mid-point of the color domain by scaling `zmin` and/or `zmax` to be equidistant to this point. Value should have the same units as in `z`. Has no effect when `zauto` is `false`.

args.name: colorscale
args.docString: Sets the colorscale. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)'], [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use`zmin` and `zmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys,YlGnBu,Greens,YlOrRd,Bluered,RdBu,Reds,Blues,Picnic,Rainbow,Portland,Jet,Hot,Blackbody,Earth,Electric,Viridis,Cividis.

args.name: autocolorscale
args.docString: Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette (`autocolorscale: true`) or the palette determined by `colorscale`. In case `colorscale` is unspecified or `autocolorscale` is true, the default  palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the `color` array are all positive, all negative or mixed.

args.name: reversescale
args.docString: Reverses the color mapping if true. If true, `zmin` will correspond to the last color in the array and `zmax` will correspond to the first color.

args.name: showscale
args.docString: Determines whether or not a colorbar is displayed for this trace.

args.name: coloraxis
args.docString: Sets a reference to a shared color axis. References to these shared color axes are *coloraxis*, *coloraxis2*, *coloraxis3*, etc. Settings for these shared color axes are set in the layout, under `layout.coloraxis`, `layout.coloraxis2`, etc. Note that multiple color scales can be linked to the same color axis.

args.name: xaxis
args.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's x coordinates and a 2D cartesian x axis. If *x* (the default value), the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis`. If *x2*, the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis2`, and so on.

args.name: yaxis
args.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's y coordinates and a 2D cartesian y axis. If *y* (the default value), the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis`. If *y2*, the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis2`, and so on.

args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  ids .

args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  customdata .

args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  meta .

args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  hoverinfo .

visible.name: enumerated
visible.docString: Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible).

opacity.name: number
opacity.docString: Sets the opacity of the trace.

name.name: string
name.docString: Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover.

uid.name: string
uid.docString: Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions.

ids.name: data_array
ids.docString: Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type.

customdata.name: data_array
customdata.docString: Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements

meta.name: any
meta.docString: Assigns extra meta information associated with this trace that can be used in various text attributes. Attributes such as trace `name`, graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `rangeselector`, `updatemenues` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. To access the trace `meta` values in an attribute in the same trace, simply use `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` item in question. To access trace `meta` in layout attributes, use `%{data[n[.meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` and `n` is the trace index.

hoverinfo.name: flaglist
hoverinfo.docString: Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired.

uirevision.name: any
uirevision.docString: Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.

z.name: data_array
z.docString: Sets the z data.

x.name: data_array
x.docString: Sets the x coordinates.

x0.name: any
x0.docString: Alternate to `x`. Builds a linear space of x coordinates. Use with `dx` where `x0` is the starting coordinate and `dx` the step.

dx.name: number
dx.docString: Sets the x coordinate step. See `x0` for more info.

y.name: data_array
y.docString: Sets the y coordinates.

y0.name: any
y0.docString: Alternate to `y`. Builds a linear space of y coordinates. Use with `dy` where `y0` is the starting coordinate and `dy` the step.

dy.name: number
dy.docString: Sets the y coordinate step. See `y0` for more info.

text.name: data_array
text.docString: Sets the text elements associated with each z value.

xtype.name: enumerated
xtype.docString: If *array*, the heatmap's x coordinates are given by *x* (the default behavior when `x` is provided). If *scaled*, the heatmap's x coordinates are given by *x0* and *dx* (the default behavior when `x` is not provided).

ytype.name: enumerated
ytype.docString: If *array*, the heatmap's y coordinates are given by *y* (the default behavior when `y` is provided) If *scaled*, the heatmap's y coordinates are given by *y0* and *dy* (the default behavior when `y` is not provided)

zsmooth.name: enumerated

zmax.name: number

zmid.name: number

To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use`zmin` and `zmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys,YlGnBu,Greens,YlOrRd,Bluered,RdBu,Reds,Blues,Picnic,Rainbow,Portland,Jet,Hot,Blackbody,Earth,Electric,Viridis,Cividis.

args.name: visible
args.docString: Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible).

args.name: name
args.docString: Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover.

args.name: uid
args.docString: Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions.

args.name: ids
args.docString: Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type.

args.name: customdata
args.docString: Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements

args.name: meta
args.docString: Assigns extra meta information associated with this trace that can be used in various text attributes. Attributes such as trace `name`, graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `rangeselector`, `updatemenues` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. To access the trace `meta` values in an attribute in the same trace, simply use `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` item in question. To access trace `meta` in layout attributes, use `%{data[n[.meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` and `n` is the trace index.

args.name: transform
args.docString: An array of operations that manipulate the trace data, for example filtering or sorting the data arrays.

args.name: uirevision
args.docString: Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.

args.name: labelangle
args.docString: Sets the angle of the labels with respect to the horizontal. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the labels vertically. Tilted labels with *labelangle* may be positioned better inside margins when `labelposition` is set to *bottom*.

args.name: labelside
args.docString: Specifies the location of the `label`. *top* positions labels above, next to the title *bottom* positions labels below the graph Tilted labels with *labelangle* may be positioned better inside margins when `labelposition` is set to *bottom*.

args.name: labelfont
args.docString: Sets the font for the `dimension` labels.

args.name: tickfont
args.docString: Sets the font for the `dimension` tick values.

args.name: rangefont
args.docString: Sets the font for the `dimension` range values.

args.name: dimension
args.docString: The dimensions (variables) of the parallel coordinates chart. 2..60 dimensions are supported.

args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  ids .

args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  customdata .

Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.

args.name: hoverinfo
args.docString: Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired.

args.name: hoveron
args.docString: Sets the hover interaction mode for the parcats diagram. If `category`, hover interaction take place per category. If `color`, hover interactions take place per color per category. If `dimension`, hover interactions take place across all categories per dimension.

args.name: hovertemplate
args.docString: Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plotly.com/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. variables `count`, `probability`, `category`, `categorycount`, `colorcount` and `bandcolorcount`. Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`.

args.name: arrangement
args.docString: Sets the drag interaction mode for categories and dimensions. If `perpendicular`, the categories can only move along a line perpendicular to the paths. If `freeform`, the categories can freely move on the plane. If `fixed`, the categories and dimensions are stationary.

args.name: bundlecolors
args.docString: Sort paths so that like colors are bundled together within each category.

args.name: sortpaths
args.docString: Sets the path sorting algorithm. If `forward`, sort paths based on dimension categories from left to right. If `backward`, sort paths based on dimensions categories from right to left.

args.name: labelfont
args.docString: Sets the font for the `dimension` labels.

args.name: tickfont
args.docString: Sets the font for the `category` labels.

args.name: dimension
args.docString: The dimensions (variables) of the parallel categories diagram.

args.name: counts
args.docString: The number of observations represented by each state. Defaults to 1 so that each state represents one observation

args.name: metasrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  meta .

args.name: countssrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  counts .

args.docString: Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items.

args.name: opacity
args.docString: Sets the opacity of the trace.

args.name: name
args.docString: Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover.

args.name: uid
args.docString: Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions.

args.name: ids
args.docString: Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type.

args.name: customdata
args.docString: Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements

args.name: meta
args.docString: Assigns extra meta information associated with this trace that can be used in various text attributes. Attributes such as trace `name`, graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `rangeselector`, `updatemenues` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. To access the trace `meta` values in an attribute in the same trace, simply use `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` item in question. To access trace `meta` in layout attributes, use `%{data[n[.meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` and `n` is the trace index.

args.name: selectedpoints
args.docString: Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect.

args.name: transform
args.docString: An array of operations that manipulate the trace data, for example filtering or sorting the data arrays.

args.name: uirevision
args.docString: Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.

args.name: lon
args.docString: Sets the longitude coordinates (in degrees East).

args.name: lat
args.docString: Sets the latitude coordinates (in degrees North).

args.name: mode
args.docString: Determines the drawing mode for this scatter trace. If the provided `mode` includes *text* then the `text` elements appear at the coordinates. Otherwise, the `text` elements appear on hover.

args.name: text
args.docString: Sets text elements associated with each (lon,lat) pair If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (lon,lat) coordinates. If trace `hoverinfo` contains a *text* flag and *hovertext* is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels.

args.name: texttemplate
args.docString: Template string used for rendering the information text that appear on points. Note that this will override `textinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. Every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. variables `lat`, `lon` and `text`.

args.name: hovertext
args.docString: Sets hover text elements associated with each (lon,lat) pair If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (lon,lat) coordinates. To be seen, trace `hoverinfo` must contain a *text* flag.

args.name: connectgaps
args.docString: Determines whether or not gaps (i.e. {nan} or missing values) in the provided data arrays are connected.

args.name: fill
args.docString: Sets the area to fill with a solid color. Use with `fillcolor` if not *none*. *toself* connects the endpoints of the trace (or each segment of the trace if it has gaps) into a closed shape.

args.name: fillcolor
args.docString: Sets the fill color. Defaults to a half-transparent variant of the line color, marker color, or marker line color, whichever is available.

args.name: textfont
args.docString: Sets the icon text font (color=mapbox.layer.paint.text-color, size=mapbox.layer.layout.text-size). Has an effect only when `type` is set to *symbol*.

args.name: textposition
args.docString: Sets the positions of the `text` elements with respects to the (x,y) coordinates.

args.name: below
args.docString: Determines if this scattermapbox trace's layers are to be inserted before the layer with the specified ID. By default, scattermapbox layers are inserted above all the base layers. To place the scattermapbox layers above every other layer, set `below` to *''*.

args.name: hoverinfo
args.docString: Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired.

args.name: hovertemplate
args.docString: Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plotly.com/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available.  Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`.

args.name: subplot
args.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's data coordinates and a mapbox subplot. If *mapbox* (the default value), the data refer to `layout.mapbox`. If *mapbox2*, the data refer to `layout.mapbox2`, and so on.

args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  ids .

args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  customdata .

args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  meta .

args.name: visible
args.docString: Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible).

args.name: legendgroup
args.docString: Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items.

args.name: name
args.docString: Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover.

args.name: uid
args.docString: Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions.

args.name: ids
args.docString: Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type.

args.name: customdata
args.docString: Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements

args.name: meta
args.docString: Assigns extra meta information associated with this trace that can be used in various text attributes. Attributes such as trace `name`, graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `rangeselector`, `updatemenues` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. To access the trace `meta` values in an attribute in the same trace, simply use `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` item in question. To access trace `meta` in layout attributes, use `%{data[n[.meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` and `n` is the trace index.

args.name: selectedpoints
args.docString: Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect.

args.name: transform
args.docString: An array of operations that manipulate the trace data, for example filtering or sorting the data arrays.

args.name: uirevision
args.docString: Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.

args.name: locations
args.docString: Sets which features found in *geojson* to plot using their feature `id` field.

args.name: z
args.docString: Sets the color values.

args.name: geojson
args.docString: Sets the GeoJSON data associated with this trace. It can be set as a valid GeoJSON object or as a URL string. Note that we only accept GeoJSONs of type *FeatureCollection* or *Feature* with geometries of type *Polygon* or *MultiPolygon*.

args.name: featureidkey
args.docString: Sets the key in GeoJSON features which is used as id to match the items included in the `locations` array. Support nested property, for example *properties.name*.

args.name: below
args.docString: Determines if the choropleth polygons will be inserted before the layer with the specified ID. By default, choroplethmapbox traces are placed above the water layers. If set to '', the layer will be inserted above every existing layer.

args.name: text
args.docString: Sets the text elements associated with each location.

args.name: hovertext
args.docString: Same as `text`.

args.name: hoverinfo
args.docString: Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired.

args.name: hovertemplate
args.docString: Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plotly.com/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. variable `properties` Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`.

args.name: showlegend
args.docString: Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend.

args.name: zauto
args.docString: Determines whether or not the color domain is computed with respect to the input data (here in `z`) or the bounds set in `zmin` and `zmax`  Defaults to `false` when `zmin` and `zmax` are set by the user.

args.name: zmin
args.docString: Sets the lower bound of the color domain. Value should have the same units as in `z` and if set, `zmax` must be set as well.

args.name: zmax
args.docString: Sets the upper bound of the color domain. Value should have the same units as in `z` and if set, `zmin` must be set as well.

args.name: zmid
args.docString: Sets the mid-point of the color domain by scaling `zmin` and/or `zmax` to be equidistant to this point. Value should have the same units as in `z`. Has no effect when `zauto` is `false`.

args.name: colorscale
args.docString: Sets the colorscale. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)'], [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use`zmin` and `zmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys,YlGnBu,Greens,YlOrRd,Bluered,RdBu,Reds,Blues,Picnic,Rainbow,Portland,Jet,Hot,Blackbody,Earth,Electric,Viridis,Cividis.

args.name: autocolorscale
args.docString: Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette (`autocolorscale: true`) or the palette determined by `colorscale`. In case `colorscale` is unspecified or `autocolorscale` is true, the default  palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the `color` array are all positive, all negative or mixed.

args.name: reversescale
args.docString: Reverses the color mapping if true. If true, `zmin` will correspond to the last color in the array and `zmax` will correspond to the first color.

args.name: showscale
args.docString: Determines whether or not a colorbar is displayed for this trace.

args.name: coloraxis
args.docString: Sets a reference to a shared color axis. References to these shared color axes are *coloraxis*, *coloraxis2*, *coloraxis3*, etc. Settings for these shared color axes are set in the layout, under `layout.coloraxis`, `layout.coloraxis2`, etc. Note that multiple color scales can be linked to the same color axis.

args.name: subplot
args.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's data coordinates and a mapbox subplot. If *mapbox* (the default value), the data refer to `layout.mapbox`. If *mapbox2*, the data refer to `layout.mapbox2`, and so on.

featureidkey.name: string
featureidkey.docString: Sets the key in GeoJSON features which is used as id to match the items included in the `locations` array. Support nested property, for example *properties.name*.

below.name: string
below.docString: Determines if the choropleth polygons will be inserted before the layer with the specified ID. By default, choroplethmapbox traces are placed above the water layers. If set to '', the layer will be inserted above every existing layer.

text.name: string
text.docString: Sets the text elements associated with each location.

hovertext.name: string
hovertext.docString: Same as `text`.

hoverinfo.name: flaglist
hoverinfo.docString: Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired.

hovertemplate.name: string
hovertemplate.docString: Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plotly.com/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. variable `properties` Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`.

showlegend.name: boolean
showlegend.docString: Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend.

zauto.name: boolean
zauto.docString: Determines whether or not the color domain is computed with respect to the input data (here in `z`) or the bounds set in `zmin` and `zmax`  Defaults to `false` when `zmin` and `zmax` are set by the user.

zmin.name: number
zmin.docString: Sets the lower bound of the color domain. Value should have the same units as in `z` and if set, `zmax` must be set as well.

zmax.name: number
zmax.docString: Sets the upper bound of the color domain. Value should have the same units as in `z` and if set, `zmin` must be set as well.

zmid.name: number
zmid.docString: Sets the mid-point of the color domain by scaling `zmin` and/or `zmax` to be equidistant to this point. Value should have the same units as in `z`. Has no effect when `zauto` is `false`.

colorscale.name: colorscale
colorscale.docString: Sets the colorscale. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)'], [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use`zmin` and `zmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys,YlGnBu,Greens,YlOrRd,Bluered,RdBu,Reds,Blues,Picnic,Rainbow,Portland,Jet,Hot,Blackbody,Earth,Electric,Viridis,Cividis.

autocolorscale.name: boolean
autocolorscale.docString: Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette (`autocolorscale: true`) or the palette determined by `colorscale`. In case `colorscale` is unspecified or `autocolorscale` is true, the default  palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the `color` array are all positive, all negative or mixed.

reversescale.name: boolean
reversescale.docString: Reverses the color mapping if true. If true, `zmin` will correspond to the last color in the array and `zmax` will correspond to the first color.

showscale.name: boolean
showscale.docString: Determines whether or not a colorbar is displayed for this trace.

coloraxis.name: subplotid
coloraxis.docString: Sets a reference to a shared color axis. References to these shared color axes are *coloraxis*, *coloraxis2*, *coloraxis3*, etc. Settings for these shared color axes are set in the layout, under `layout.coloraxis`, `layout.coloraxis2`, etc. Note that multiple color scales can be linked to the same color axis.

subplot.name: subplotid
subplot.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's data coordinates and a mapbox subplot. If *mapbox* (the default value), the data refer to `layout.mapbox`. If *mapbox2*, the data refer to `layout.mapbox2`, and so on.
