args.name: visible
args.docString: Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible).

args.name: legendgroup
args.docString: Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items.

args.name: opacity
args.docString: Sets the opacity of the trace.

args.name: name
args.docString: Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover.

args.name: uid
args.docString: Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions.

args.name: ids
args.docString: Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type.

args.name: customdata
args.docString: Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements

args.name: meta
args.docString: Assigns extra meta information associated with this trace that can be used in various text attributes. Attributes such as trace `name`, graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `rangeselector`, `updatemenues` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. To access the trace `meta` values in an attribute in the same trace, simply use `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` item in question. To access trace `meta` in layout attributes, use `%{data[n[.meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` and `n` is the trace index.

args.name: transform
args.docString: An array of operations that manipulate the trace data, for example filtering or sorting the data arrays.

args.name: uirevision
args.docString: Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.

args.name: lon
args.docString: Sets the longitude coordinates (in degrees East).

args.name: lat
args.docString: Sets the latitude coordinates (in degrees North).

args.name: z
args.docString: Sets the points' weight. For example, a value of 10 would be equivalent to having 10 points of weight 1 in the same spot

args.name: radius
args.docString: Sets the radius of influence of one `lon` / `lat` point in pixels. Increasing the value makes the densitymapbox trace smoother, but less detailed.

args.name: below
args.docString: Determines if the densitymapbox trace will be inserted before the layer with the specified ID. By default, densitymapbox traces are placed below the first layer of type symbol If set to '', the layer will be inserted above every existing layer.

args.name: text
args.docString: Sets text elements associated with each (lon,lat) pair If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (lon,lat) coordinates. If trace `hoverinfo` contains a *text* flag and *hovertext* is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels.

args.name: hovertext
args.docString: Sets hover text elements associated with each (lon,lat) pair If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (lon,lat) coordinates. To be seen, trace `hoverinfo` must contain a *text* flag.

args.name: visible
args.docString: Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible).

args.name: name
args.docString: Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover.

args.name: uid
args.docString: Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions.

args.name: ids
args.docString: Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type.

args.name: customdata
args.docString: Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements

args.name: meta
args.docString: Assigns extra meta information associated with this trace that can be used in various text attributes. Attributes such as trace `name`, graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `rangeselector`, `updatemenues` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. To access the trace `meta` values in an attribute in the same trace, simply use `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` item in question. To access trace `meta` in layout attributes, use `%{data[n[.meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` and `n` is the trace index.

args.name: selectedpoints
args.docString: Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect.

args.name: uirevision
args.docString: Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.

args.name: hoverinfo
args.docString: Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired. Note that this attribute is superseded by `node.hoverinfo` and `node.hoverinfo` for nodes and links respectively.

args.name: orientation
args.docString: Sets the orientation of the Sankey diagram.

args.name: valueformat
args.docString: Sets the value formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-language which is similar to those of Python. See https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format

args.name: valuesuffix
args.docString: Adds a unit to follow the value in the hover tooltip. Add a space if a separation is necessary from the value.

args.name: arrangement
args.docString: If value is `snap` (the default), the node arrangement is assisted by automatic snapping of elements to preserve space between nodes specified via `nodepad`. If value is `perpendicular`, the nodes can only move along a line perpendicular to the flow. If value is `freeform`, the nodes can freely move on the plane. If value is `fixed`, the nodes are stationary.

args.name: textfont
args.docString: Sets the font for node labels

args.name: node
args.docString: The nodes of the Sankey plot.

args.name: link
args.docString: The links of the Sankey plot.

args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  meta .

visible.name: enumerated
visible.docString: Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible).

name.name: string
name.docString: Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover.

uid.name: string
uid.docString: Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions.

ids.name: data_array
ids.docString: Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type.

customdata.name: data_array
customdata.docString: Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements

meta.name: any
meta.docString: Assigns extra meta information associated with this trace that can be used in various text attributes. Attributes such as trace `name`, graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `rangeselector`, `updatemenues` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. To access the trace `meta` values in an attribute in the same trace, simply use `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` item in question. To access trace `meta` in layout attributes, use `%{data[n[.meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` and `n` is the trace index.

selectedpoints.name: any
selectedpoints.docString: Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect.

uirevision.name: any
uirevision.docString: Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.

hoverinfo.name: flaglist
hoverinfo.docString: Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired. Note that this attribute is superseded by `node.hoverinfo` and `node.hoverinfo` for nodes and links respectively.

orientation.name: enumerated
orientation.docString: Sets the orientation of the Sankey diagram.

valueformat.name: string
valueformat.docString: Sets the value formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-language which is similar to those of Python. See https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format

valuesuffix.name: string
valuesuffix.docString: Adds a unit to follow the value in the hover tooltip. Add a space if a separation is necessary from the value.

arrangement.name: enumerated
arrangement.docString: If value is `snap` (the default), the node arrangement is assisted by automatic snapping of elements to preserve space between nodes specified via `nodepad`. If value is `perpendicular`, the nodes can only move along a line perpendicular to the flow. If value is `freeform`, the nodes can freely move on the plane. If value is `fixed`, the nodes are stationary.

args.name: carpet
args.docString: An identifier for this carpet, so that `scattercarpet` and `contourcarpet` traces can specify a carpet plot on which they lie

args.name: x
args.docString: A two dimensional array of x coordinates at each carpet point. If omitted, the plot is a cheater plot and the xaxis is hidden by default.

args.name: y
args.docString: A two dimensional array of y coordinates at each carpet point.

args.name: a
args.docString: An array containing values of the first parameter value

args.name: a0
args.docString: Alternate to `a`. Builds a linear space of a coordinates. Use with `da` where `a0` is the starting coordinate and `da` the step.

args.name: da
args.docString: Sets the a coordinate step. See `a0` for more info.

args.name: b
args.docString: A two dimensional array of y coordinates at each carpet point.

args.name: b0
args.docString: Alternate to `b`. Builds a linear space of a coordinates. Use with `db` where `b0` is the starting coordinate and `db` the step.

args.name: db
args.docString: Sets the b coordinate step. See `b0` for more info.

args.name: cheaterslope
args.docString: The shift applied to each successive row of data in creating a cheater plot. Only used if `x` is been omitted.

args.name: font
args.docString: The default font used for axis & tick labels on this carpet

args.name: color
args.docString: Sets default for all colors associated with this axis all at once: line, font, tick, and grid colors. Grid color is lightened by blending this with the plot background Individual pieces can override this.

args.name: xaxis
args.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's x coordinates and a 2D cartesian x axis. If *x* (the default value), the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis`. If *x2*, the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis2`, and so on.

args.name: yaxis
args.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's y coordinates and a 2D cartesian y axis. If *y* (the default value), the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis`. If *y2*, the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis2`, and so on.

args.docString: Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements

args.name: meta
args.docString: Assigns extra meta information associated with this trace that can be used in various text attributes. Attributes such as trace `name`, graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `rangeselector`, `updatemenues` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. To access the trace `meta` values in an attribute in the same trace, simply use `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` item in question. To access trace `meta` in layout attributes, use `%{data[n[.meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` and `n` is the trace index.

args.name: selectedpoints
args.docString: Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect.

args.name: transform
args.docString: An array of operations that manipulate the trace data, for example filtering or sorting the data arrays.

args.name: uirevision
args.docString: Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.

args.name: carpet
args.docString: An identifier for this carpet, so that `scattercarpet` and `contourcarpet` traces can specify a carpet plot on which they lie

args.name: a
args.docString: Sets the a-axis coordinates.

args.name: b
args.docString: Sets the b-axis coordinates.

args.name: mode
args.docString: Determines the drawing mode for this scatter trace. If the provided `mode` includes *text* then the `text` elements appear at the coordinates. Otherwise, the `text` elements appear on hover. If there are less than 20 points and the trace is not stacked then the default is *lines+markers*. Otherwise, *lines*.

args.name: text
args.docString: Sets text elements associated with each (a,b) point. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of strings, the items are mapped in order to the the data points in (a,b). If trace `hoverinfo` contains a *text* flag and *hovertext* is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels.

args.name: texttemplate
args.docString: Template string used for rendering the information text that appear on points. Note that this will override `textinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. Every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. variables `a`, `b` and `text`.

args.name: hovertext
args.docString: Sets hover text elements associated with each (a,b) point. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of strings, the items are mapped in order to the the data points in (a,b). To be seen, trace `hoverinfo` must contain a *text* flag.

args.name: connectgaps
args.docString: Determines whether or not gaps (i.e. {nan} or missing values) in the provided data arrays are connected.

args.name: fill
args.docString: Sets the area to fill with a solid color. Use with `fillcolor` if not *none*. scatterternary has a subset of the options available to scatter. *toself* connects the endpoints of the trace (or each segment of the trace if it has gaps) into a closed shape. *tonext* fills the space between two traces if one completely encloses the other (eg consecutive contour lines), and behaves like *toself* if there is no trace before it. *tonext* should not be used if one trace does not enclose the other.

args.name: fillcolor
args.docString: Sets the fill color. Defaults to a half-transparent variant of the line color, marker color, or marker line color, whichever is available.

args.name: textfont
args.docString: Sets the text font.

args.name: textposition
args.docString: Sets the positions of the `text` elements with respects to the (x,y) coordinates.

args.name: hoverinfo
args.docString: Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired.

args.name: hoveron
args.docString: Do the hover effects highlight individual points (markers or line points) or do they highlight filled regions? If the fill is *toself* or *tonext* and there are no markers or text, then the default is *fills*, otherwise it is *points*.

args.name: hovertemplate
args.docString: Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plotly.com/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available.  Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`.

args.name: xaxis
args.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's x coordinates and a 2D cartesian x axis. If *x* (the default value), the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis`. If *x2*, the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis2`, and so on.

args.name: yaxis
args.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's y coordinates and a 2D cartesian y axis. If *y* (the default value), the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis`. If *y2*, the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis2`, and so on.

args.name: idssrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  ids .

args.name: customdatasrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  customdata .

args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  meta .

args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  a .

args.name: bsrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  b .

args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  textposition .

args.name: visible
args.docString: Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible).

args.name: showlegend
args.docString: Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend.

args.name: legendgroup
args.docString: Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items.

args.name: opacity
args.docString: Sets the opacity of the trace.

args.name: name
args.docString: Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover.

args.name: uid
args.docString: Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions.

args.name: ids
args.docString: Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type.

args.name: customdata
args.docString: Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements

args.name: meta
args.docString: Assigns extra meta information associated with this trace that can be used in various text attributes. Attributes such as trace `name`, graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `rangeselector`, `updatemenues` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. To access the trace `meta` values in an attribute in the same trace, simply use `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` item in question. To access trace `meta` in layout attributes, use `%{data[n[.meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` and `n` is the trace index.

args.name: uirevision
args.docString: Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.

args.name: carpet
args.docString: The `carpet` of the carpet axes on which this contour trace lies

args.name: z
args.docString: Sets the z data.

args.name: a
args.docString: Sets the x coordinates.

args.name: a0
args.docString: Alternate to `x`. Builds a linear space of x coordinates. Use with `dx` where `x0` is the starting coordinate and `dx` the step.

args.name: da
args.docString: Sets the x coordinate step. See `x0` for more info.

args.name: b
args.docString: Sets the y coordinates.

args.name: b0
args.docString: Alternate to `y`. Builds a linear space of y coordinates. Use with `dy` where `y0` is the starting coordinate and `dy` the step.

args.name: db
args.docString: Sets the y coordinate step. See `y0` for more info.

args.name: text
args.docString: Sets the text elements associated with each z value.

args.name: hovertext
args.docString: Same as `text`.

args.name: transpose
args.docString: Transposes the z data.

args.name: atype
args.docString: If *array*, the heatmap's x coordinates are given by *x* (the default behavior when `x` is provided). If *scaled*, the heatmap's x coordinates are given by *x0* and *dx* (the default behavior when `x` is not provided).

args.name: btype
args.docString: If *array*, the heatmap's y coordinates are given by *y* (the default behavior when `y` is provided) If *scaled*, the heatmap's y coordinates are given by *y0* and *dy* (the default behavior when `y` is not provided)

args.name: fillcolor
args.docString: Sets the fill color if `contours.type` is *constraint*. Defaults to a half-transparent variant of the line color, marker color, or marker line color, whichever is available.

args.name: autocontour
args.docString: Determines whether or not the contour level attributes are picked by an algorithm. If *true*, the number of contour levels can be set in `ncontours`. If *false*, set the contour level attributes in `contours`.

args.name: ncontours
args.docString: Sets the maximum number of contour levels. The actual number of contours will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to the value of `ncontours`. Has an effect only if `autocontour` is *true* or if `contours.size` is missing.

args.name: zauto
args.docString: Determines whether or not the color domain is computed with respect to the input data (here in `z`) or the bounds set in `zmin` and `zmax`  Defaults to `false` when `zmin` and `zmax` are set by the user.

args.name: zmin
args.docString: Sets the lower bound of the color domain. Value should have the same units as in `z` and if set, `zmax` must be set as well.

args.name: zmax
args.docString: Sets the upper bound of the color domain. Value should have the same units as in `z` and if set, `zmin` must be set as well.

args.name: zmid
args.docString: Sets the mid-point of the color domain by scaling `zmin` and/or `zmax` to be equidistant to this point. Value should have the same units as in `z`. Has no effect when `zauto` is `false`.

args.name: colorscale
args.docString: Sets the colorscale. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)'], [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use`zmin` and `zmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys,YlGnBu,Greens,YlOrRd,Bluered,RdBu,Reds,Blues,Picnic,Rainbow,Portland,Jet,Hot,Blackbody,Earth,Electric,Viridis,Cividis.

args.name: autocolorscale
args.docString: Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette (`autocolorscale: true`) or the palette determined by `colorscale`. In case `colorscale` is unspecified or `autocolorscale` is true, the default  palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the `color` array are all positive, all negative or mixed.

args.name: reversescale
args.docString: Reverses the color mapping if true. If true, `zmin` will correspond to the last color in the array and `zmax` will correspond to the first color.

args.name: showscale
args.docString: Determines whether or not a colorbar is displayed for this trace.

args.name: coloraxis
args.docString: Sets a reference to a shared color axis. References to these shared color axes are *coloraxis*, *coloraxis2*, *coloraxis3*, etc. Settings for these shared color axes are set in the layout, under `layout.coloraxis`, `layout.coloraxis2`, etc. Note that multiple color scales can be linked to the same color axis.

args.name: xaxis
args.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's x coordinates and a 2D cartesian x axis. If *x* (the default value), the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis`. If *x2*, the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis2`, and so on.

args.name: yaxis
args.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's y coordinates and a 2D cartesian y axis. If *y* (the default value), the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis`. If *y2*, the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis2`, and so on.

carpet.name: string
carpet.docString: The `carpet` of the carpet axes on which this contour trace lies

z.name: data_array
z.docString: Sets the z data.

a0.name: any
a0.docString: Alternate to `x`. Builds a linear space of x coordinates. Use with `dx` where `x0` is the starting coordinate and `dx` the step.

da.name: number
da.docString: Sets the x coordinate step. See `x0` for more info.

b0.name: any
b0.docString: Alternate to `y`. Builds a linear space of y coordinates. Use with `dy` where `y0` is the starting coordinate and `dy` the step.

db.name: number
db.docString: Sets the y coordinate step. See `y0` for more info.

text.name: data_array
text.docString: Sets the text elements associated with each z value.

hovertext.name: data_array
hovertext.docString: Same as `text`.

atype.name: enumerated
atype.docString: If *array*, the heatmap's x coordinates are given by *x* (the default behavior when `x` is provided). If *scaled*, the heatmap's x coordinates are given by *x0* and *dx* (the default behavior when `x` is not provided).

btype.name: enumerated
btype.docString: If *array*, the heatmap's y coordinates are given by *y* (the default behavior when `y` is provided) If *scaled*, the heatmap's y coordinates are given by *y0* and *dy* (the default behavior when `y` is not provided)

fillcolor.name: color
fillcolor.docString: Sets the fill color if `contours.type` is *constraint*. Defaults to a half-transparent variant of the line color, marker color, or marker line color, whichever is available.

autocontour.name: boolean
autocontour.docString: Determines whether or not the contour level attributes are picked by an algorithm. If *true*, the number of contour levels can be set in `ncontours`. If *false*, set the contour level attributes in `contours`.

ncontours.name: integer
ncontours.docString: Sets the maximum number of contour levels. The actual number of contours will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to the value of `ncontours`. Has an effect only if `autocontour` is *true* or if `contours.size` is missing.

zauto.name: boolean
zauto.docString: Determines whether or not the color domain is computed with respect to the input data (here in `z`) or the bounds set in `zmin` and `zmax`  Defaults to `false` when `zmin` and `zmax` are set by the user.

zmin.name: number
zmin.docString: Sets the lower bound of the color domain. Value should have the same units as in `z` and if set, `zmax` must be set as well.

zmax.name: number
zmax.docString: Sets the upper bound of the color domain. Value should have the same units as in `z` and if set, `zmin` must be set as well.

zmid.name: number
zmid.docString: Sets the mid-point of the color domain by scaling `zmin` and/or `zmax` to be equidistant to this point. Value should have the same units as in `z`. Has no effect when `zauto` is `false`.

colorscale.name: colorscale
colorscale.docString: Sets the colorscale. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)'], [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use`zmin` and `zmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys,YlGnBu,Greens,YlOrRd,Bluered,RdBu,Reds,Blues,Picnic,Rainbow,Portland,Jet,Hot,Blackbody,Earth,Electric,Viridis,Cividis.

autocolorscale.name: boolean
autocolorscale.docString: Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette (`autocolorscale: true`) or the palette determined by `colorscale`. In case `colorscale` is unspecified or `autocolorscale` is true, the default  palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the `color` array are all positive, all negative or mixed.

reversescale.name: boolean
reversescale.docString: Reverses the color mapping if true. If true, `zmin` will correspond to the last color in the array and `zmax` will correspond to the first color.

showscale.name: boolean
showscale.docString: Determines whether or not a colorbar is displayed for this trace.

coloraxis.name: subplotid
coloraxis.docString: Sets a reference to a shared color axis. References to these shared color axes are *coloraxis*, *coloraxis2*, *coloraxis3*, etc. Settings for these shared color axes are set in the layout, under `layout.coloraxis`, `layout.coloraxis2`, etc. Note that multiple color scales can be linked to the same color axis.

xaxis.name: subplotid
xaxis.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's x coordinates and a 2D cartesian x axis. If *x* (the default value), the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis`. If *x2*, the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis2`, and so on.

yaxis.name: subplotid
yaxis.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's y coordinates and a 2D cartesian y axis. If *y* (the default value), the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis`. If *y2*, the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis2`, and so on.

idssrc.name: string
idssrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  ids .

customdatasrc.name: string
customdatasrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  customdata .

metasrc.name: string
metasrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  meta .

zsrc.name: string
zsrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  z .

asrc.name: string
asrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  a .

bsrc.name: string
bsrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  b .

textsrc.name: string
textsrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  text .

hovertextsrc.name: string
hovertextsrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  hovertext .

args.name: visible
args.docString: Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible).

args.name: showlegend
args.docString: Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend.

args.name: legendgroup
args.docString: Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items.

args.name: opacity
args.docString: Sets the opacity of the trace.

args.name: name
args.docString: Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover.

args.name: uid
args.docString: Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions.

args.name: ids
args.docString: Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type.

args.name: customdata
args.docString: Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements

args.name: meta
args.docString: Assigns extra meta information associated with this trace that can be used in various text attributes. Attributes such as trace `name`, graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `rangeselector`, `updatemenues` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. To access the trace `meta` values in an attribute in the same trace, simply use `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` item in question. To access trace `meta` in layout attributes, use `%{data[n[.meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` and `n` is the trace index.

args.name: selectedpoints
args.docString: Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect.

args.name: hoverinfo
args.docString: Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired.

args.name: transform
args.docString: An array of operations that manipulate the trace data, for example filtering or sorting the data arrays.

args.name: uirevision
args.docString: Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.

args.name: xperiod
args.docString: Only relevant when the axis `type` is *date*. Sets the period positioning in milliseconds or *M<n>* on the x axis. Special values in the form of *M<n>* could be used to declare the number of months. In this case `n` must be a positive integer.

args.name: xperiod0
args.docString: Only relevant when the axis `type` is *date*. Sets the base for period positioning in milliseconds or date string on the x0 axis. When `x0period` is round number of weeks, the `x0period0` by default would be on a Sunday i.e. 2000-01-02, otherwise it would be at 2000-01-01.

args.name: xperiodalignment
args.docString: Only relevant when the axis `type` is *date*. Sets the alignment of data points on the x axis.

args.name: x
args.docString: Sets the x coordinates. If absent, linear coordinate will be generated.

args.name: open
args.docString: Sets the open values.

args.name: high
args.docString: Sets the high values.

args.name: low
args.docString: Sets the low values.

args.name: close
args.docString: Sets the close values.

args.name: text
args.docString: Sets hover text elements associated with each sample point. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to this trace's sample points.

args.name: hovertext
args.docString: Same as `text`.

args.name: tickwidth
args.docString: Sets the width of the open/close tick marks relative to the *x* minimal interval.

args.name: xcalendar
args.docString: Sets the calendar system to use with `x` date data.

args.name: xaxis
args.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's x coordinates and a 2D cartesian x axis. If *x* (the default value), the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis`. If *x2*, the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis2`, and so on.

args.name: yaxis
args.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's y coordinates and a 2D cartesian y axis. If *y* (the default value), the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis`. If *y2*, the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis2`, and so on.

xperiod0.docString: Only relevant when the axis `type` is *date*. Sets the base for period positioning in milliseconds or date string on the x0 axis. When `x0period` is round number of weeks, the `x0period0` by default would be on a Sunday i.e. 2000-01-02, otherwise it would be at 2000-01-01.

xperiodalignment.name: enumerated
xperiodalignment.docString: Only relevant when the axis `type` is *date*. Sets the alignment of data points on the x axis.

x.name: data_array
x.docString: Sets the x coordinates. If absent, linear coordinate will be generated.

text.name: string
text.docString: Sets hover text elements associated with each sample point. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to this trace's sample points.

hovertext.name: string
hovertext.docString: Same as `text`.

whiskerwidth.name: number
whiskerwidth.docString: Sets the width of the whiskers relative to the box' width. For example, with 1, the whiskers are as wide as the box(es).

xcalendar.name: enumerated
xcalendar.docString: Sets the calendar system to use with `x` date data.

xaxis.name: subplotid
xaxis.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's x coordinates and a 2D cartesian x axis. If *x* (the default value), the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis`. If *x2*, the x coordinates refer to `layout.xaxis2`, and so on.

yaxis.name: subplotid
yaxis.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's y coordinates and a 2D cartesian y axis. If *y* (the default value), the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis`. If *y2*, the y coordinates refer to `layout.yaxis2`, and so on.

customdatasrc.name: string
customdatasrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  customdata .

metasrc.name: string
metasrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  meta .

xsrc.name: string
xsrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  x .

opensrc.name: string
opensrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  open .

lowsrc.name: string
lowsrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  low .

closesrc.name: string
closesrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  close .

args.name: visible
args.docString: Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible).

args.name: showlegend
args.docString: Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend.

args.name: legendgroup
args.docString: Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items.

args.name: opacity
args.docString: Sets the opacity of the trace.

args.name: name
args.docString: Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover.

args.name: uid
args.docString: Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions.

args.name: ids
args.docString: Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type.

args.name: customdata
args.docString: Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements

args.name: meta
args.docString: Assigns extra meta information associated with this trace that can be used in various text attributes. Attributes such as trace `name`, graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `rangeselector`, `updatemenues` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. To access the trace `meta` values in an attribute in the same trace, simply use `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` item in question. To access trace `meta` in layout attributes, use `%{data[n[.meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` and `n` is the trace index.

args.name: selectedpoints
args.docString: Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect.

args.name: transform
args.docString: An array of operations that manipulate the trace data, for example filtering or sorting the data arrays.

args.name: uirevision
args.docString: Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.

args.name: mode
args.docString: Determines the drawing mode for this scatter trace. If the provided `mode` includes *text* then the `text` elements appear at the coordinates. Otherwise, the `text` elements appear on hover. If there are less than 20 points and the trace is not stacked then the default is *lines+markers*. Otherwise, *lines*.

args.name: r
args.docString: Sets the radial coordinates

args.name: theta
args.docString: Sets the angular coordinates

args.name: r0
args.docString: Alternate to `r`. Builds a linear space of r coordinates. Use with `dr` where `r0` is the starting coordinate and `dr` the step.

args.name: dr
args.docString: Sets the r coordinate step.

args.name: theta0
args.docString: Alternate to `theta`. Builds a linear space of theta coordinates. Use with `dtheta` where `theta0` is the starting coordinate and `dtheta` the step.

args.name: dtheta
args.docString: Sets the theta coordinate step. By default, the `dtheta` step equals the subplot's period divided by the length of the `r` coordinates.

args.name: thetaunit
args.docString: Sets the unit of input *theta* values. Has an effect only when on *linear* angular axes.

args.name: text
args.docString: Sets text elements associated with each (x,y) pair. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (x,y) coordinates. If trace `hoverinfo` contains a *text* flag and *hovertext* is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels.

args.name: texttemplate
args.docString: Template string used for rendering the information text that appear on points. Note that this will override `textinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. Every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. variables `r`, `theta` and `text`.

args.name: hovertext
args.docString: Sets hover text elements associated with each (x,y) pair. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (x,y) coordinates. To be seen, trace `hoverinfo` must contain a *text* flag.

args.name: connectgaps
args.docString: Determines whether or not gaps (i.e. {nan} or missing values) in the provided data arrays are connected.

args.name: cliponaxis
args.docString: Determines whether or not markers and text nodes are clipped about the subplot axes. To show markers and text nodes above axis lines and tick labels, make sure to set `xaxis.layer` and `yaxis.layer` to *below traces*.

args.name: textposition
args.docString: Sets the positions of the `text` elements with respects to the (x,y) coordinates.

args.name: textfont
args.docString: Sets the text font.

args.name: fill
args.docString: Sets the area to fill with a solid color. Use with `fillcolor` if not *none*. scatterpolar has a subset of the options available to scatter. *toself* connects the endpoints of the trace (or each segment of the trace if it has gaps) into a closed shape. *tonext* fills the space between two traces if one completely encloses the other (eg consecutive contour lines), and behaves like *toself* if there is no trace before it. *tonext* should not be used if one trace does not enclose the other.

args.name: fillcolor
args.docString: Sets the fill color. Defaults to a half-transparent variant of the line color, marker color, or marker line color, whichever is available.

args.name: hoverinfo
args.docString: Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired.

args.name: hoveron
args.docString: Do the hover effects highlight individual points (markers or line points) or do they highlight filled regions? If the fill is *toself* or *tonext* and there are no markers or text, then the default is *fills*, otherwise it is *points*.

args.name: hovertemplate
args.docString: Template string used for rendering the information that appear on hover box. Note that this will override `hoverinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plotly.com/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available.  Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`.

args.name: subplot
args.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's data coordinates and a polar subplot. If *polar* (the default value), the data refer to `layout.polar`. If *polar2*, the data refer to `layout.polar2`, and so on.

args.name: idssrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  ids .

args.name: customdatasrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  customdata .

args.name: metasrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  meta .

args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  r .

args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  theta .

args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  text .

args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  texttemplate .

args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  textposition .

The variables available in `hovertemplate` are the ones emitted as event data described at this link https://plotly.com/javascript/plotlyjs-events/#event-data. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available.  Anything contained in tag `<extra>` is displayed in the secondary box, for example "<extra>{fullData.name}</extra>". To hide the secondary box completely, use an empty tag `<extra></extra>`.

args.name: connectgaps
args.docString: Determines whether or not gaps (i.e. {nan} or missing values) in the provided data arrays are connected.

args.name: fill
args.docString: Sets the area to fill with a solid color. Defaults to *none* unless this trace is stacked, then it gets *tonexty* (*tonextx*) if `orientation` is *v* (*h*) Use with `fillcolor` if not *none*. *tozerox* and *tozeroy* fill to x=0 and y=0 respectively. *tonextx* and *tonexty* fill between the endpoints of this trace and the endpoints of the trace before it, connecting those endpoints with straight lines (to make a stacked area graph); if there is no trace before it, they behave like *tozerox* and *tozeroy*. *toself* connects the endpoints of the trace (or each segment of the trace if it has gaps) into a closed shape. *tonext* fills the space between two traces if one completely encloses the other (eg consecutive contour lines), and behaves like *toself* if there is no trace before it. *tonext* should not be used if one trace does not enclose the other. Traces in a `stackgroup` will only fill to (or be filled to) other traces in the same group. With multiple `stackgroup`s or some traces stacked and some not, if fill-linked traces are not already consecutive, the later ones will be pushed down in the drawing order.

args.name: fillcolor
args.docString: Sets the fill color. Defaults to a half-transparent variant of the line color, marker color, or marker line color, whichever is available.

args.name: textposition
args.docString: Sets the positions of the `text` elements with respects to the (x,y) coordinates.

args.name: textfont
args.docString: Sets the text font.

args.name: hoverinfo
args.docString: Determines which trace information appear on hover. If `none` or `skip` are set, no information is displayed upon hovering. But, if `none` is set, click and hover events are still fired.

args.name: subplot
args.docString: Sets a reference between this trace's data coordinates and a polar subplot. If *polar* (the default value), the data refer to `layout.polar`. If *polar2*, the data refer to `layout.polar2`, and so on.

visible.name: enumerated
visible.docString: Determines whether or not this trace is visible. If *legendonly*, the trace is not drawn, but can appear as a legend item (provided that the legend itself is visible).

showlegend.name: boolean
showlegend.docString: Determines whether or not an item corresponding to this trace is shown in the legend.

legendgroup.name: string
legendgroup.docString: Sets the legend group for this trace. Traces part of the same legend group hide/show at the same time when toggling legend items.

opacity.name: number
opacity.docString: Sets the opacity of the trace.

name.name: string
name.docString: Sets the trace name. The trace name appear as the legend item and on hover.

uid.name: string
uid.docString: Assign an id to this trace, Use this to provide object constancy between traces during animations and transitions.

ids.name: data_array
ids.docString: Assigns id labels to each datum. These ids for object constancy of data points during animation. Should be an array of strings, not numbers or any other type.

customdata.name: data_array
customdata.docString: Assigns extra data each datum. This may be useful when listening to hover, click and selection events. Note that, *scatter* traces also appends customdata items in the markers DOM elements

meta.name: any
meta.docString: Assigns extra meta information associated with this trace that can be used in various text attributes. Attributes such as trace `name`, graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `rangeselector`, `updatemenues` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. To access the trace `meta` values in an attribute in the same trace, simply use `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` item in question. To access trace `meta` in layout attributes, use `%{data[n[.meta[i]}` where `i` is the index or key of the `meta` and `n` is the trace index.

selectedpoints.name: any
selectedpoints.docString: Array containing integer indices of selected points. Has an effect only for traces that support selections. Note that an empty array means an empty selection where the `unselected` are turned on for all points, whereas, any other non-array values means no selection all where the `selected` and `unselected` styles have no effect.

uirevision.name: any
uirevision.docString: Controls persistence of some user-driven changes to the trace: `constraintrange` in `parcoords` traces, as well as some `editable: true` modifications such as `name` and `colorbar.title`. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`. Note that other user-driven trace attribute changes are controlled by `layout` attributes: `trace.visible` is controlled by `layout.legend.uirevision`, `selectedpoints` is controlled by `layout.selectionrevision`, and `colorbar.(x|y)` (accessible with `config: {editable: true}`) is controlled by `layout.editrevision`. Trace changes are tracked by `uid`, which only falls back on trace index if no `uid` is provided. So if your app can add/remove traces before the end of the `data` array, such that the same trace has a different index, you can still preserve user-driven changes if you give each trace a `uid` that stays with it as it moves.

mode.name: flaglist
mode.docString: Determines the drawing mode for this scatter trace. If the provided `mode` includes *text* then the `text` elements appear at the coordinates. Otherwise, the `text` elements appear on hover. If there are less than 20 points and the trace is not stacked then the default is *lines+markers*. Otherwise, *lines*.

r0.name: any
r0.docString: Alternate to `r`. Builds a linear space of r coordinates. Use with `dr` where `r0` is the starting coordinate and `dr` the step.

theta0.name: any
theta0.docString: Alternate to `theta`. Builds a linear space of theta coordinates. Use with `dtheta` where `theta0` is the starting coordinate and `dtheta` the step.

dtheta.name: number
dtheta.docString: Sets the theta coordinate step. By default, the `dtheta` step equals the subplot's period divided by the length of the `r` coordinates.

thetaunit.name: enumerated
thetaunit.docString: Sets the unit of input *theta* values. Has an effect only when on *linear* angular axes.

text.name: string
text.docString: Sets text elements associated with each (x,y) pair. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (x,y) coordinates. If trace `hoverinfo` contains a *text* flag and *hovertext* is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels.

texttemplate.name: string
texttemplate.docString: Template string used for rendering the information text that appear on points. Note that this will override `textinfo`. Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Dates are formatted using d3-time-format's syntax %{variable|d3-time-format}, for example "Day: %{2019-01-01|%A}". https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format for details on the date formatting syntax. Every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. variables `r`, `theta` and `text`.

hovertext.name: string
hovertext.docString: Sets hover text elements associated with each (x,y) pair. If a single string, the same string appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (x,y) coordinates. To be seen, trace `hoverinfo` must contain a *text* flag.

hovertemplate.name: string

Variables are inserted using %{variable}, for example "y: %{y}". Numbers are formatted using d3-format's syntax %{variable:d3-format}, for example "Price: %{y:$.2f}". https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format for details on the formatting syntax. Additionally, every attributes that can be specified per-point (the ones that are `arrayOk: true`) are available. Traces in a `stackgroup` will only fill to (or be filled to) other traces in the same group. With multiple `stackgroup`s or some traces stacked and some not, if fill-linked traces are not already consecutive, the later ones will be pushed down in the drawing order.

args.name: font
args.docString: Sets the global font. Note that fonts used in traces and other layout components inherit from the global font.

args.name: autosize
args.docString: Determines whether or not a layout width or height that has been left undefined by the user is initialized on each relayout. Note that, regardless of this attribute, an undefined layout width or height is always initialized on the first call to plot.

args.name: width
args.docString: Sets the plot's width (in px).

args.name: height
args.docString: Sets the plot's height (in px).

args.name: computed
args.docString: Placeholder for exporting automargin-impacting values namely `margin.t`, `margin.b`, `margin.l` and `margin.r` in *full-json* mode.

args.name: paper_bgcolor
args.docString: Sets the background color of the paper where the graph is drawn.

args.name: plot_bgcolor
args.docString: Sets the background color of the plotting area in-between x and y axes.

args.name: autotypenumbers
args.docString: Using *strict* a numeric string in trace data is not converted to a number. Using *convert types* a numeric string in trace data may be treated as a number during automatic axis `type` detection. This is the default value; however it could be overridden for individual axes.

args.name: separators
args.docString: Sets the decimal and thousand separators. For example, *. * puts a '.' before decimals and a space between thousands. In English locales, dflt is *.,* but other locales may alter this default.

args.name: hidesources
args.docString: Determines whether or not a text link citing the data source is placed at the bottom-right cored of the figure. Has only an effect only on graphs that have been generated via forked graphs from the Chart Studio Cloud (at https://chart-studio.plotly.com or on-premise).

args.name: showlegend
args.docString: Determines whether or not a legend is drawn. Default is `true` if there is a trace to show and any of these: a) Two or more traces would by default be shown in the legend. b) One pie trace is shown in the legend. c) One trace is explicitly given with `showlegend: true`.

args.name: colorway
args.docString: Sets the default trace colors.

args.name: datarevision
args.docString: If provided, a changed value tells `Plotly.react` that one or more data arrays has changed. This way you can modify arrays in-place rather than making a complete new copy for an incremental change. If NOT provided, `Plotly.react` assumes that data arrays are being treated as immutable, thus any data array with a different identity from its predecessor contains new data.

args.name: uirevision
args.docString: Used to allow user interactions with the plot to persist after `Plotly.react` calls that are unaware of these interactions. If `uirevision` is omitted, or if it is given and it changed from the previous `Plotly.react` call, the exact new figure is used. If `uirevision` is truthy and did NOT change, any attribute that has been affected by user interactions and did not receive a different value in the new figure will keep the interaction value. `layout.uirevision` attribute serves as the default for `uirevision` attributes in various sub-containers. For finer control you can set these sub-attributes directly. For example, if your app separately controls the data on the x and y axes you might set `xaxis.uirevision=*time*` and `yaxis.uirevision=*cost*`. Then if only the y data is changed, you can update `yaxis.uirevision=*quantity*` and the y axis range will reset but the x axis range will retain any user-driven zoom.

args.name: editrevision
args.docString: Controls persistence of user-driven changes in `editable: true` configuration, other than trace names and axis titles. Defaults to `layout.uirevision`.

args.name: selectionrevision
args.docString: Controls persistence of user-driven changes in selected points from all traces.

args.name: template
args.docString: Default attributes to be applied to the plot. Templates can be created from existing plots using `Plotly.makeTemplate`, or created manually. They should be objects with format: `{layout: layoutTemplate, data: {[type]: [traceTemplate, ...]}, ...}` `layoutTemplate` and `traceTemplate` are objects matching the attribute structure of `layout` and a data trace.  Trace templates are applied cyclically to traces of each type. Container arrays (eg `annotations`) have special handling: An object ending in `defaults` (eg `annotationdefaults`) is applied to each array item. But if an item has a `templateitemname` key we look in the template array for an item with matching `name` and apply that instead. If no matching `name` is found we mark the item invisible. Any named template item not referenced is appended to the end of the array, so you can use this for a watermark annotation or a logo image, for example. To omit one of these items on the plot, make an item with matching `templateitemname` and `visible: false`.

args.name: meta
args.docString: Assigns extra meta information that can be used in various `text` attributes. Attributes such as the graph, axis and colorbar `title.text`, annotation `text` `trace.name` in legend items, `rangeselector`, `updatemenus` and `sliders` `label` text all support `meta`. One can access `meta` fields using template strings: `%{meta[i]}` where `i` is the index of the `meta` item in question. `meta` can also be an object for example `{key: value}` which can be accessed %{meta[key]}.

args.name: transition
args.docString: Sets transition options used during Plotly.react updates.

args.name: clickmode
args.docString: Determines the mode of single click interactions. *event* is the default value and emits the `plotly_click` event. In addition this mode emits the `plotly_selected` event in drag modes *lasso* and *select*, but with no event data attached (kept for compatibility reasons). The *select* flag enables selecting single data points via click. This mode also supports persistent selections, meaning that pressing Shift while clicking, adds to / subtracts from an existing selection. *select* with `hovermode`: *x* can be confusing, consider explicitly setting `hovermode`: *closest* when using this feature. Selection events are sent accordingly as long as *event* flag is set as well. When the *event* flag is missing, `plotly_click` and `plotly_selected` events are not fired.

args.name: dragmode
args.docString: Determines the mode of drag interactions. *select* and *lasso* apply only to scatter traces with markers or text. *orbit* and *turntable* apply only to 3D scenes.

args.name: hovermode
args.docString: Determines the mode of hover interactions. If *closest*, a single hoverlabel will appear for the *closest* point within the `hoverdistance`. If *x* (or *y*), multiple hoverlabels will appear for multiple points at the *closest* x- (or y-) coordinate within the `hoverdistance`, with the caveat that no more than one hoverlabel will appear per trace. If *x unified* (or *y unified*), a single hoverlabel will appear multiple points at the closest x- (or y-) coordinate within the `hoverdistance` with the caveat that no more than one hoverlabel will appear per trace. In this mode, spikelines are enabled by default perpendicular to the specified axis. If false, hover interactions are disabled. If `clickmode` includes the *select* flag, `hovermode` defaults to *closest*. If `clickmode` lacks the *select* flag, it defaults to *x* or *y* (depending on the trace's `orientation` value) for plots based on cartesian coordinates. For anything else the default value is *closest*.

args.name: hoverdistance
args.docString: Sets the default distance (in pixels) to look for data to add hover labels (-1 means no cutoff, 0 means no looking for data). This is only a real distance for hovering on point-like objects, like scatter points. For area-like objects (bars, scatter fills, etc) hovering is on inside the area and off outside, but these objects will not supersede hover on point-like objects in case of conflict.

args.name: spikedistance
args.docString: Sets the default distance (in pixels) to look for data to draw spikelines to (-1 means no cutoff, 0 means no looking for data). As with hoverdistance, distance does not apply to area-like objects. In addition, some objects can be hovered on but will not generate spikelines, such as scatter fills.

args.name: selectdirection
args.docString: When `dragmode` is set to *select*, this limits the selection of the drag to horizontal, vertical or diagonal. *h* only allows horizontal selection, *v* only vertical, *d* only diagonal and *any* sets no limit.

args.name: calendar
args.docString: Sets the default calendar system to use for interpreting and displaying dates throughout the plot.

args.name: metasrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  meta .

autosize.name: boolean
autosize.docString: Determines whether or not a layout width or height that has been left undefined by the user is initialized on each relayout. Note that, regardless of this attribute, an undefined layout width or height is always initialized on the first call to plot.

width.name: number
width.docString: Sets the plot's width (in px).

computed.name: any
computed.docString: Placeholder for exporting automargin-impacting values namely `margin.t`, `margin.b`, `margin.l` and `margin.r` in *full-json* mode.

paper_bgcolor.name: color
paper_bgcolor.docString: Sets the background color of the paper where the graph is drawn.

plot_bgcolor.name: color
plot_bgcolor.docString: Sets the background color of the plotting area in-between x and y axes.

selectionrevision.name: any
selectionrevision.docString: Controls persistence of user-driven changes in selected points from all traces.

clickmode.name: flaglist
clickmode.docString: Determines the mode of single click interactions. *event* is the default value and emits the `plotly_click` event. metasrc.name: string
metasrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  meta .

args.name: bgcolor
args.docString: Sets the background color of the hover labels for this trace

args.name: bordercolor
args.docString: Sets the border color of the hover labels for this trace.

args.name: font
args.docString: Sets the font used in hover labels.

args.name: align
args.docString: Sets the horizontal alignment of the text content within hover label box. Has an effect only if the hover label text spans more two or more lines

args.name: namelength
args.docString: Sets the default length (in number of characters) of the trace name in the hover labels for all traces. -1 shows the whole name regardless of length. 0-3 shows the first 0-3 characters, and an integer >3 will show the whole name if it is less than that many characters, but if it is longer, will truncate to `namelength - 3` characters and add an ellipsis.

args.name: bgcolorsrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  bgcolor .

args.name: bordercolorsrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  bordercolor .

args.name: alignsrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  align .

args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  namelength .

args.name: token
args.docString: The stream id number links a data trace on a plot with a stream. See https://chart-studio.plotly.com/settings for more details.

args.name: maxpoints
args.docString: Sets the maximum number of points to keep on the plots from an incoming stream. If `maxpoints` is set to *50*, only the newest 50 points will be displayed on the plot.

token.name: string

returns.name: Transform
returns.docString: An array of operations that manipulate the trace data, for example filtering or sorting the data arrays.

args.name: family
args.docString: HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The Chart Studio Cloud (at https://chart-studio.plotly.com or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*.

args.name: familysrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  family .

args.name: sizesrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  size .

args.name: colorsrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  color .

returns.name: Textfont
