args.name: color
args.docString: Sets the color of the contour level. Has no effect if `contours.coloring` is set to *lines*.

args.name: width
args.docString: Sets the contour line width in (in px)

args.name: dash
args.docString: Sets the dash style of lines. Set to a dash type string (*solid*, *dot*, *dash*, *longdash*, *dashdot*, or *longdashdot*) or a dash length list in px (eg *5px,10px,2px,2px*).

args.name: smoothing
args.docString: Sets the amount of smoothing for the contour lines, where *0* corresponds to no smoothing.

color.name: color
color.docString: Sets the color of the contour level. Has no effect if `contours.coloring` is set to *lines*.

width.name: number
width.docString: Sets the contour line width in (in px)

dash.name: string
dash.docString: Sets the dash style of lines. Set to a dash type string (*solid*, *dot*, *dash*, *longdash*, *dashdot*, or *longdashdot*) or a dash length list in px (eg *5px,10px,2px,2px*).

smoothing.name: number
smoothing.docString: Sets the amount of smoothing for the contour lines, where *0* corresponds to no smoothing.

args.name: thicknessmode
args.docString: Determines whether this color bar's thickness (i.e. the measure in the constant color direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels*. Use `thickness` to set the value.

args.name: thickness
args.docString: Sets the thickness of the color bar This measure excludes the size of the padding, ticks and labels.

args.name: lenmode
args.docString: Determines whether this color bar's length (i.e. the measure in the color variation direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels. Use `len` to set the value.

args.name: len
args.docString: Sets the length of the color bar This measure excludes the padding of both ends. That is, the color bar length is this length minus the padding on both ends.

args.name: x
args.docString: Sets the x position of the color bar (in plot fraction).

args.name: xanchor
args.docString: Sets this color bar's horizontal position anchor. This anchor binds the `x` position to the *left*, *center* or *right* of the color bar.

args.name: xpad
args.docString: Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the x direction.

args.name: y
args.docString: Sets the y position of the color bar (in plot fraction).

args.name: yanchor
args.docString: Sets this color bar's vertical position anchor This anchor binds the `y` position to the *top*, *middle* or *bottom* of the color bar.

args.name: ypad
args.docString: Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the y direction.

args.name: outlinecolor
args.docString: Sets the axis line color.

args.name: outlinewidth
args.docString: Sets the width (in px) of the axis line.

args.name: bordercolor
args.docString: Sets the axis line color.

args.name: borderwidth
args.docString: Sets the width (in px) or the border enclosing this color bar.

args.name: bgcolor
args.docString: Sets the color of padded area.

args.name: tickmode
args.docString: Sets the tick mode for this axis. If *auto*, the number of ticks is set via `nticks`. If *linear*, the placement of the ticks is determined by a starting position `tick0` and a tick step `dtick` (*linear* is the default value if `tick0` and `dtick` are provided). If *array*, the placement of the ticks is set via `tickvals` and the tick text is `ticktext`. (*array* is the default value if `tickvals` is provided).

args.name: nticks
args.docString: Specifies the maximum number of ticks for the particular axis. The actual number of ticks will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to `nticks`. Has an effect only if `tickmode` is set to *auto*.

args.name: tick0
args.docString: Sets the placement of the first tick on this axis. Use with `dtick`. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your starting tick (e.g. to set the starting tick to 100, set the `tick0` to 2) except when `dtick`=*L<f>* (see `dtick` for more info). If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be a date string, like date data. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be a number, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears.

args.name: dtick
args.docString: Sets the step in-between ticks on this axis. Use with `tick0`. Must be a positive number, or special strings available to *log* and *date* axes. If the axis `type` is *log*, then ticks are set every 10^(n*dtick) where n is the tick number. For example, to set a tick mark at 1, 10, 100, 1000, ... set dtick to 1. To set tick marks at 1, 100, 10000, ... set dtick to 2. To set tick marks at 1, 5, 25, 125, 625, 3125, ... set dtick to log_10(5), or 0.69897000433. *log* has several special values; *L<f>*, where `f` is a positive number, gives ticks linearly spaced in value (but not position). For example `tick0` = 0.1, `dtick` = *L0.5* will put ticks at 0.1, 0.6, 1.1, 1.6 etc. To show powers of 10 plus small digits between, use *D1* (all digits) or *D2* (only 2 and 5). `tick0` is ignored for *D1* and *D2*. If the axis `type` is *date*, then you must convert the time to milliseconds. For example, to set the interval between ticks to one day, set `dtick` to 86400000.0. *date* also has special values *M<n>* gives ticks spaced by a number of months. `n` must be a positive integer. To set ticks on the 15th of every third month, set `tick0` to *2000-01-15* and `dtick` to *M3*. To set ticks every 4 years, set `dtick` to *M48*

args.name: tickvals
args.docString: Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `ticktext`.

args.name: ticktext
args.docString: Sets the text displayed at the ticks position via `tickvals`. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `tickvals`.

args.name: ticks
args.docString: Determines whether ticks are drawn or not. If **, this axis' ticks are not drawn. If *outside* (*inside*), this axis' are drawn outside (inside) the axis lines.

args.name: ticklabelposition
args.docString: Determines where tick labels are drawn.

args.name: ticklen
args.docString: Sets the tick length (in px).

args.name: tickwidth
args.docString: Sets the tick width (in px).

args.name: tickcolor
args.docString: Sets the tick color.

args.name: showticklabels
args.docString: Determines whether or not the tick labels are drawn.

args.name: tickfont
args.docString: Sets the color bar's tick label font

args.name: tickangle
args.docString: Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the horizontal. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically.

args.name: tickformat
args.docString: Sets the tick label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46*

args.name: tickprefix
args.docString: Sets a tick label prefix.

args.name: showtickprefix
args.docString: If *all*, all tick labels are displayed with a prefix. If *first*, only the first tick is displayed with a prefix. If *last*, only the last tick is displayed with a suffix. If *none*, tick prefixes are hidden.

args.name: ticksuffix
args.docString: Sets a tick label suffix.

args.name: showticksuffix
args.docString: Same as `showtickprefix` but for tick suffixes.

args.name: separatethousands
args.docString: If "true", even 4-digit integers are separated

args.name: exponentformat
args.docString: Determines a formatting rule for the tick exponents. For example, consider the number 1,000,000,000. If *none*, it appears as 1,000,000,000. If *e*, 1e+9. If *E*, 1E+9. If *power*, 1x10^9 (with 9 in a super script). If *SI*, 1G. If *B*, 1B.

args.name: minexponent
args.docString: Hide SI prefix for 10^n if |n| is below this number. This only has an effect when `tickformat` is *SI* or *B*.

args.name: showexponent
args.docString: If *all*, all exponents are shown besides their significands. If *first*, only the exponent of the first tick is shown. If *last*, only the exponent of the last tick is shown. If *none*, no exponents appear.

args.name: tickvalssrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  tickvals .

args.name: ticktextsrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  ticktext .

ticks.name: enumerated
ticks.docString: Determines whether ticks are drawn or not. If **, this axis' ticks are not drawn. If *outside* (*inside*), this axis' are drawn outside (inside) the axis lines.

ticklabelposition.name: enumerated
ticklabelposition.docString: Determines where tick labels are drawn.

showticklabels.name: boolean
showticklabels.docString: Determines whether or not the tick labels are drawn.

tickangle.name: angle
tickangle.docString: Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the horizontal. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically.

tickformat.name: string
tickformat.docString: Sets the tick label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46*

showtickprefix.name: enumerated
showtickprefix.docString: If *all*, all tick labels are displayed with a prefix. If *first*, only the first tick is displayed with a prefix. If *last*, only the last tick is displayed with a suffix. If *none*, tick prefixes are hidden.

showticksuffix.name: enumerated
showticksuffix.docString: Same as `showtickprefix` but for tick suffixes.

exponentformat.name: enumerated
exponentformat.docString: Determines a formatting rule for the tick exponents. For example, consider the number 1,000,000,000. If *none*, it appears as 1,000,000,000. If *e*, 1e+9. If *E*, 1E+9. If *power*, 1x10^9 (with 9 in a super script). If *SI*, 1G. If *B*, 1B.

minexponent.name: number
minexponent.docString: Hide SI prefix for 10^n if |n| is below this number. This only has an effect when `tickformat` is *SI* or *B*.

showexponent.name: enumerated
showexponent.docString: If *all*, all exponents are shown besides their significands. If *first*, only the exponent of the first tick is shown. If *last*, only the exponent of the last tick is shown. If *none*, no exponents appear.

tickvalssrc.name: string
tickvalssrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  tickvals .

ticktextsrc.name: string
ticktextsrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  ticktext .

args.name: family
args.docString: HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The Chart Studio Cloud (at https://chart-studio.plotly.com or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*.

args.name: familysrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  family .

args.name: sizesrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  size .

args.name: colorsrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  color .

returns.name: Font

args.name: enabled
args.docString: Determines whether or not this stop is used. If `false`, this stop is ignored even within its `dtickrange`.

args.name: dtickrange
args.docString: range [*min*, *max*], where *min*, *max* - dtick values which describe some zoom level, it is possible to omit *min* or *max* value by passing *null*

args.name: value
args.docString: string - dtickformat for described zoom level, the same as *tickformat*

args.name: name
args.docString: When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template.

args.name: templateitemname
args.docString: Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`.

enabled.name: boolean
enabled.docString: Determines whether or not this stop is used. If `false`, this stop is ignored even within its `dtickrange`.

dtickrange.name: info_array
dtickrange.docString: range [*min*, *max*], where *min*, *max* - dtick values which describe some zoom level, it is possible to omit *min* or *max* value by passing *null*

value.name: string
value.docString: string - dtickformat for described zoom level, the same as *tickformat*

name.name: string

You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template.

templateitemname.name: string

Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`.

args.name: text
args.docString: Sets the title of the color bar. Note that before the existence of `title.text`, the title's contents used to be defined as the `title` attribute itself. This behavior has been deprecated.

args.name: font
args.docString: Sets this color bar's title font. Note that the title's font used to be set by the now deprecated `titlefont` attribute.

args.name: side
args.docString: Determines the location of color bar's title with respect to the color bar. Note that the title's location used to be set by the now deprecated `titleside` attribute.

args.name: bgcolor
args.docString: Sets the background color of the hover labels for this trace

args.name: bordercolor
args.docString: Sets the border color of the hover labels for this trace.

args.name: font
args.docString: Sets the font used in hover labels.

args.name: align
args.docString: Sets the horizontal alignment of the text content within hover label box. Has an effect only if the hover label text spans more two or more lines

args.name: namelength
args.docString: Sets the default length (in number of characters) of the trace name in the hover labels for all traces. -1 shows the whole name regardless of length. 0-3 shows the first 0-3 characters, and an integer >3 will show the whole name if it is less than that many characters, but if it is longer, will truncate to `namelength - 3` characters and add an ellipsis.

args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  bgcolor .

args.name: bordercolorsrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  bordercolor .

args.name: alignsrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  align .

args.name: token
args.docString: The stream id number links a data trace on a plot with a stream. See https://chart-studio.plotly.com/settings for more details.

args.name: maxpoints
args.docString: Sets the maximum number of points to keep on the plots from an incoming stream. If `maxpoints` is set to *50*, only the newest 50 points will be displayed on the plot.

token.name: string
token.docString: The stream id number links a data trace on a plot with a stream. See https://chart-studio.plotly.com/settings for more details.

maxpoints.name: number
maxpoints.docString: Sets the maximum number of points to keep on the plots from an incoming stream. If `maxpoints` is set to *50*, only the newest 50 points will be displayed on the plot.

returns.name: Transform
returns.docString: An array of operations that manipulate the trace data, for example filtering or sorting the data arrays.

args.name: type
args.docString: If `levels`, the data is represented as a contour plot with multiple levels displayed. If `constraint`, the data is represented as constraints with the invalid region shaded as specified by the `operation` and `value` parameters.

args.name: start
args.docString: Sets the starting contour level value. Must be less than `contours.end`

args.name: end
args.docString: Sets the end contour level value. Must be more than `contours.start`

args.name: size
args.docString: Sets the step between each contour level. Must be positive.

args.name: coloring
args.docString: Determines the coloring method showing the contour values. If *fill*, coloring is done evenly between each contour level If *heatmap*, a heatmap gradient coloring is applied between each contour level. If *lines*, coloring is done on the contour lines. If *none*, no coloring is applied on this trace.

args.name: showlines
args.docString: Determines whether or not the contour lines are drawn. Has an effect only if `contours.coloring` is set to *fill*.

args.name: showlabels
args.docString: Determines whether to label the contour lines with their values.

args.name: labelfont
args.docString: Sets the font used for labeling the contour levels. The default color comes from the lines, if shown. The default family and size come from `layout.font`.

args.name: labelformat
args.docString: Sets the contour label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-language which is very similar to Python, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format

args.name: operation
args.docString: Sets the constraint operation. *=* keeps regions equal to `value` *<* and *<=* keep regions less than `value` *>* and *>=* keep regions greater than `value` *[]*, *()*, *[)*, and *(]* keep regions inside `value[0]` to `value[1]` *][*, *)(*, *](*, *)[* keep regions outside `value[0]` to value[1]` Open vs. closed intervals make no difference to constraint display, but all versions are allowed for consistency with filter transforms.

args.name: value
args.docString: Sets the value or values of the constraint boundary. When `operation` is set to one of the comparison values (=,<,>=,>,<=) *value* is expected to be a number. When `operation` is set to one of the interval values ([],(),[),(],][,)(,](,)[) *value* is expected to be an array of two numbers where the first is the lower bound and the second is the upper bound.

type.name: enumerated
type.docString: If `levels`, the data is represented as a contour plot with multiple levels displayed. If `constraint`, the data is represented as constraints with the invalid region shaded as specified by the `operation` and `value` parameters.

start.name: number
start.docString: Sets the starting contour level value. Must be less than `contours.end`

end.name: number
end.docString: Sets the end contour level value. Must be more than `contours.start`

size.name: number
size.docString: Sets the step between each contour level. Must be positive.

coloring.name: enumerated
coloring.docString: Determines the coloring method showing the contour values. If *fill*, coloring is done evenly between each contour level If *heatmap*, a heatmap gradient coloring is applied between each contour level. If *lines*, coloring is done on the contour lines. If *none*, no coloring is applied on this trace.

showlines.name: boolean
showlines.docString: Determines whether or not the contour lines are drawn. Has an effect only if `contours.coloring` is set to *fill*.

showlabels.name: boolean
showlabels.docString: Determines whether to label the contour lines with their values.

labelformat.name: string
labelformat.docString: Sets the contour label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-language which is very similar to Python, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format

operation.name: enumerated
operation.docString: Sets the constraint operation. *=* keeps regions equal to `value` *<* and *<=* keep regions less than `value` *>* and *>=* keep regions greater than `value` *[]*, *()*, *[)*, and *(]* keep regions inside `value[0]` to `value[1]` *][*, *)(*, *](*, *)[* keep regions outside `value[0]` to value[1]` Open vs. closed intervals make no difference to constraint display, but all versions are allowed for consistency with filter transforms.

value.name: any
value.docString: Sets the value or values of the constraint boundary. When `operation` is set to one of the comparison values (=,<,>=,>,<=) *value* is expected to be a number. When `operation` is set to one of the interval values ([],(),[),(],][,)(,](,)[) *value* is expected to be an array of two numbers where the first is the lower bound and the second is the upper bound.

args.name: color
args.docString: Sets the color of the contour level. Has no effect if `contours.coloring` is set to *lines*.

args.name: width
args.docString: Sets the contour line width in (in px) Defaults to *0.5* when `contours.type` is *levels*. Defaults to *2* when `contour.type` is *constraint*.

args.name: dash
args.docString: Sets the dash style of lines. Set to a dash type string (*solid*, *dot*, *dash*, *longdash*, *dashdot*, or *longdashdot*) or a dash length list in px (eg *5px,10px,2px,2px*).

args.name: smoothing
args.docString: Sets the amount of smoothing for the contour lines, where *0* corresponds to no smoothing.

color.name: color
color.docString: Sets the color of the contour level. Has no effect if `contours.coloring` is set to *lines*.

width.name: number
width.docString: Sets the contour line width in (in px) Defaults to *0.5* when `contours.type` is *levels*. Defaults to *2* when `contour.type` is *constraint*.

dash.name: string
dash.docString: Sets the dash style of lines. Set to a dash type string (*solid*, *dot*, *dash*, *longdash*, *dashdot*, or *longdashdot*) or a dash length list in px (eg *5px,10px,2px,2px*).

smoothing.name: number
smoothing.docString: Sets the amount of smoothing for the contour lines, where *0* corresponds to no smoothing.

args.name: thicknessmode
args.docString: Determines whether this color bar's thickness (i.e. the measure in the constant color direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels*. Use `thickness` to set the value.

args.name: thickness
args.docString: Sets the thickness of the color bar This measure excludes the size of the padding, ticks and labels.

args.name: lenmode
args.docString: Determines whether this color bar's length (i.e. the measure in the color variation direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels. Use `len` to set the value.

args.name: len
args.docString: Sets the length of the color bar This measure excludes the padding of both ends. That is, the color bar length is this length minus the padding on both ends.

args.name: x
args.docString: Sets the x position of the color bar (in plot fraction).

args.name: xanchor
args.docString: Sets this color bar's horizontal position anchor. This anchor binds the `x` position to the *left*, *center* or *right* of the color bar.

args.name: xpad
args.docString: Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the x direction.

args.name: y
args.docString: Sets the y position of the color bar (in plot fraction).

args.name: yanchor
args.docString: Sets this color bar's vertical position anchor This anchor binds the `y` position to the *top*, *middle* or *bottom* of the color bar.

args.name: ypad
args.docString: Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the y direction.

args.name: outlinecolor
args.docString: Sets the axis line color.

args.name: outlinewidth
args.docString: Sets the width (in px) of the axis line.

args.name: bordercolor
args.docString: Sets the axis line color.

args.name: borderwidth
args.docString: Sets the width (in px) or the border enclosing this color bar.

args.name: bgcolor
args.docString: Sets the color of padded area.

args.name: tickmode
args.docString: Sets the tick mode for this axis. If *auto*, the number of ticks is set via `nticks`. If *linear*, the placement of the ticks is determined by a starting position `tick0` and a tick step `dtick` (*linear* is the default value if `tick0` and `dtick` are provided). If *array*, the placement of the ticks is set via `tickvals` and the tick text is `ticktext`. (*array* is the default value if `tickvals` is provided).

args.name: nticks
args.docString: Specifies the maximum number of ticks for the particular axis. The actual number of ticks will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to `nticks`. Has an effect only if `tickmode` is set to *auto*.

args.name: tick0
args.docString: Sets the placement of the first tick on this axis. Use with `dtick`. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your starting tick (e.g. to set the starting tick to 100, set the `tick0` to 2) except when `dtick`=*L<f>* (see `dtick` for more info). If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be a date string, like date data. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be a number, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears.

args.name: dtick
args.docString: Sets the step in-between ticks on this axis. Use with `tick0`. Must be a positive number, or special strings available to *log* and *date* axes. If the axis `type` is *log*, then ticks are set every 10^(n*dtick) where n is the tick number. For example, to set a tick mark at 1, 10, 100, 1000, ... set dtick to 1. To set tick marks at 1, 100, 10000, ... set dtick to 2. To set tick marks at 1, 5, 25, 125, 625, 3125, ... set dtick to log_10(5), or 0.69897000433. *log* has several special values; *L<f>*, where `f` is a positive number, gives ticks linearly spaced in value (but not position). For example `tick0` = 0.1, `dtick` = *L0.5* will put ticks at 0.1, 0.6, 1.1, 1.6 etc. To show powers of 10 plus small digits between, use *D1* (all digits) or *D2* (only 2 and 5). `tick0` is ignored for *D1* and *D2*. If the axis `type` is *date*, then you must convert the time to milliseconds. For example, to set the interval between ticks to one day, set `dtick` to 86400000.0. *date* also has special values *M<n>* gives ticks spaced by a number of months. `n` must be a positive integer. To set ticks on the 15th of every third month, set `tick0` to *2000-01-15* and `dtick` to *M3*. To set ticks every 4 years, set `dtick` to *M48*

args.name: tickvals
args.docString: Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `ticktext`.

args.name: ticktext
args.docString: Sets the text displayed at the ticks position via `tickvals`. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `tickvals`.

args.name: ticks
args.docString: Determines whether ticks are drawn or not. If **, this axis' ticks are not drawn. If *outside* (*inside*), this axis' are drawn outside (inside) the axis lines.

args.name: ticklabelposition
args.docString: Determines where tick labels are drawn.

args.name: ticklen
args.docString: Sets the tick length (in px).

args.name: tickwidth
args.docString: Sets the tick width (in px).

args.name: tickcolor
args.docString: Sets the tick color.

args.name: showticklabels
args.docString: Determines whether or not the tick labels are drawn.

args.name: tickfont
args.docString: Sets the color bar's tick label font

args.name: tickangle
args.docString: Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the horizontal. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically.

args.name: tickformat
args.docString: Sets the tick label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46*

args.name: tickprefix
args.docString: Sets a tick label prefix.

args.name: showtickprefix
args.docString: If *all*, all tick labels are displayed with a prefix. If *first*, only the first tick is displayed with a prefix. If *last*, only the last tick is displayed with a suffix. If *none*, tick prefixes are hidden.

args.name: ticksuffix
args.docString: Sets a tick label suffix.

args.name: showticksuffix
args.docString: Same as `showtickprefix` but for tick suffixes.

args.name: separatethousands
args.docString: If "true", even 4-digit integers are separated

args.name: exponentformat
args.docString: Determines a formatting rule for the tick exponents. For example, consider the number 1,000,000,000. If *none*, it appears as 1,000,000,000. If *e*, 1e+9. If *E*, 1E+9. If *power*, 1x10^9 (with 9 in a super script). If *SI*, 1G. If *B*, 1B.

args.name: minexponent
args.docString: Hide SI prefix for 10^n if |n| is below this number. This only has an effect when `tickformat` is *SI* or *B*.

args.name: showexponent
args.docString: If *all*, all exponents are shown besides their significands. If *first*, only the exponent of the first tick is shown. If *last*, only the exponent of the last tick is shown. If *none*, no exponents appear.

args.name: tickvalssrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  tickvals .

args.name: ticktextsrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  ticktext .

thicknessmode.name: enumerated
thicknessmode.docString: Determines whether this color bar's thickness (i.e. the measure in the constant color direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels*. Use `thickness` to set the value.

thickness.name: number
thickness.docString: Sets the thickness of the color bar This measure excludes the size of the padding, ticks and labels.

lenmode.name: enumerated
lenmode.docString: Determines whether this color bar's length (i.e. the measure in the color variation direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels. Use `len` to set the value.

len.name: number
len.docString: Sets the length of the color bar This measure excludes the padding of both ends. That is, the color bar length is this length minus the padding on both ends.

x.name: number
x.docString: Sets the x position of the color bar (in plot fraction).

xanchor.name: enumerated
xanchor.docString: Sets this color bar's horizontal position anchor. This anchor binds the `x` position to the *left*, *center* or *right* of the color bar.

xpad.name: number
xpad.docString: Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the x direction.

y.name: number
y.docString: Sets the y position of the color bar (in plot fraction).

yanchor.name: enumerated
yanchor.docString: Sets this color bar's vertical position anchor This anchor binds the `y` position to the *top*, *middle* or *bottom* of the color bar.

ypad.name: number
ypad.docString: Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the y direction.

outlinewidth.name: number
outlinewidth.docString: Sets the width (in px) of the axis line.

bordercolor.name: color
bordercolor.docString: Sets the axis line color.

borderwidth.name: number
borderwidth.docString: Sets the width (in px) or the border enclosing this color bar.

bgcolor.name: color
bgcolor.docString: Sets the color of padded area.

tickmode.name: enumerated
tickmode.docString: Sets the tick mode for this axis. If *auto*, the number of ticks is set via `nticks`. If *linear*, the placement of the ticks is determined by a starting position `tick0` and a tick step `dtick` (*linear* is the default value if `tick0` and `dtick` are provided). If *array*, the placement of the ticks is set via `tickvals` and the tick text is `ticktext`. (*array* is the default value if `tickvals` is provided).

nticks.name: integer
nticks.docString: Specifies the maximum number of ticks for the particular axis. The actual number of ticks will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to `nticks`. Has an effect only if `tickmode` is set to *auto*.

tick0.name: any
tick0.docString: Sets the placement of the first tick on this axis. Use with `dtick`. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your starting tick (e.g. to set the starting tick to 100, set the `tick0` to 2) except when `dtick`=*L<f>* (see `dtick` for more info). If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be a date string, like date data. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be a number, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears.

dtick.name: any
dtick.docString: Sets the step in-between ticks on this axis. Use with `tick0`. Must be a positive number, or special strings available to *log* and *date* axes. If the axis `type` is *log*, then ticks are set every 10^(n*dtick) where n is the tick number. For example, to set a tick mark at 1, 10, 100, 1000, ... set dtick to 1. To set tick marks at 1, 100, 10000, ... set dtick to 2. To set tick marks at 1, 5, 25, 125, 625, 3125, ... set dtick to log_10(5), or 0.69897000433. *log* has several special values; *L<f>*, where `f` is a positive number, gives ticks linearly spaced in value (but not position). For example `tick0` = 0.1, `dtick` = *L0.5* will put ticks at 0.1, 0.6, 1.1, 1.6 etc. To show powers of 10 plus small digits between, use *D1* (all digits) or *D2* (only 2 and 5). `tick0` is ignored for *D1* and *D2*. If the axis `type` is *date*, then you must convert the time to milliseconds. For example, to set the interval between ticks to one day, set `dtick` to 86400000.0. *date* also has special values *M<n>* gives ticks spaced by a number of months. `n` must be a positive integer. To set ticks on the 15th of every third month, set `tick0` to *2000-01-15* and `dtick` to *M3*. To set ticks every 4 years, set `dtick` to *M48*

tickvals.name: data_array
tickvals.docString: Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `ticktext`.

ticktext.name: data_array
ticktext.docString: Sets the text displayed at the ticks position via `tickvals`. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `tickvals`.

ticks.name: enumerated
ticks.docString: Determines whether ticks are drawn or not. If **, this axis' ticks are not drawn. If *outside* (*inside*), this axis' are drawn outside (inside) the axis lines.

ticklabelposition.name: enumerated
ticklabelposition.docString: Determines where tick labels are drawn.

showticklabels.name: boolean
showticklabels.docString: Determines whether or not the tick labels are drawn.

tickangle.name: angle
tickangle.docString: Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the horizontal. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically.

tickformat.name: string
tickformat.docString: Sets the tick label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46*

showtickprefix.name: enumerated
showtickprefix.docString: If *all*, all tick labels are displayed with a prefix. If *first*, only the first tick is displayed with a prefix. If *last*, only the last tick is displayed with a suffix. If *none*, tick prefixes are hidden.

showticksuffix.name: enumerated
showticksuffix.docString: Same as `showtickprefix` but for tick suffixes.

exponentformat.name: enumerated
exponentformat.docString: Determines a formatting rule for the tick exponents. For example, consider the number 1,000,000,000. If *none*, it appears as 1,000,000,000. If *e*, 1e+9. If *E*, 1E+9. If *power*, 1x10^9 (with 9 in a super script). If *SI*, 1G. If *B*, 1B.

minexponent.name: number
minexponent.docString: Hide SI prefix for 10^n if |n| is below this number. This only has an effect when `tickformat` is *SI* or *B*.

showexponent.name: enumerated
showexponent.docString: If *all*, all exponents are shown besides their significands. If *first*, only the exponent of the first tick is shown. If *last*, only the exponent of the last tick is shown. If *none*, no exponents appear.

tickvalssrc.name: string
tickvalssrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  tickvals .

ticktextsrc.name: string
ticktextsrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  ticktext .

args.name: family
args.docString: HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The Chart Studio Cloud (at https://chart-studio.plotly.com or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*.

args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  family .

args.name: sizesrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  size .

args.name: colorsrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  color .

returns.name: Font

args.name: enabled
args.docString: Determines whether or not this stop is used. If `false`, this stop is ignored even within its `dtickrange`.

args.name: dtickrange
args.docString: range [*min*, *max*], where *min*, *max* - dtick values which describe some zoom level, it is possible to omit *min* or *max* value by passing *null*

args.name: value
args.docString: string - dtickformat for described zoom level, the same as *tickformat*

args.name: name
args.docString: When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template.

args.name: templateitemname
args.docString: Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`.

enabled.docString: Determines whether or not this stop is used. If `false`, this stop is ignored even within its `dtickrange`.

Has no effect outside of a template.

If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`.

args.name: text
args.docString: Sets the title of the color bar. Note that before the existence of `title.text`, the title's contents used to be defined as the `title` attribute itself. This behavior has been deprecated.

args.name: side
args.docString: Determines the location of color bar's title with respect to the color bar. Note that the title's location used to be set by the now deprecated `titleside` attribute.

args.name: bgcolor
args.docString: Sets the background color of the hover labels for this trace

args.name: bordercolor
args.docString: Sets the border color of the hover labels for this trace.

args.name: font
args.docString: Sets the font used in hover labels.

args.name: align
args.docString: Sets the horizontal alignment of the text content within hover label box. Has an effect only if the hover label text spans more two or more lines

args.name: namelength
args.docString: Sets the default length (in number of characters) of the trace name in the hover labels for all traces. -1 shows the whole name regardless of length. 0-3 shows the first 0-3 characters, and an integer >3 will show the whole name if it is less than that many characters, but if it is longer, will truncate to `namelength - 3` characters and add an ellipsis.

args.name: token
args.docString: The stream id number links a data trace on a plot with a stream. See https://chart-studio.plotly.com/settings for more details.

args.name: maxpoints
args.docString: Sets the maximum number of points to keep on the plots from an incoming stream. If `maxpoints` is set to *50*, only the newest 50 points will be displayed on the plot.

args.name: color
args.docString: Sets the line color.

args.name: width
args.docString: Sets the line width (in px).

args.name: dash
args.docString: Sets the dash style of lines. Set to a dash type string (*solid*, *dot*, *dash*, *longdash*, *dashdot*, or *longdashdot*) or a dash length list in px (eg *5px,10px,2px,2px*).

args.name: shape
args.docString: Determines the line shape. With *spline* the lines are drawn using spline interpolation. The other available values correspond to step-wise line shapes.

args.name: smoothing
args.docString: Has an effect only if `shape` is set to *spline* Sets the amount of smoothing. *0* corresponds to no smoothing (equivalent to a *linear* shape).

color.name: color
color.docString: Sets the line color.

width.name: number
width.docString: Sets the line width (in px).

dash.name: string
dash.docString: Sets the dash style of lines. Set to a dash type string (*solid*, *dot*, *dash*, *longdash*, *dashdot*, or *longdashdot*) or a dash length list in px (eg *5px,10px,2px,2px*).

shape.name: enumerated
shape.docString: Determines the line shape. With *spline* the lines are drawn using spline interpolation. The other available values correspond to step-wise line shapes.

smoothing.name: number
smoothing.docString: Has an effect only if `shape` is set to *spline* Sets the amount of smoothing. *0* corresponds to no smoothing (equivalent to a *linear* shape).

args.name: symbol
args.docString: Sets the marker symbol type. Adding 100 is equivalent to appending *-open* to a symbol name. Adding 200 is equivalent to appending *-dot* to a symbol name. Adding 300 is equivalent to appending *-open-dot* or *dot-open* to a symbol name.

args.name: opacity
args.docString: Sets the marker opacity.

args.name: maxdisplayed
args.docString: Sets a maximum number of points to be drawn on the graph. *0* corresponds to no limit.

args.name: size
args.docString: Sets the marker size (in px).

args.name: sizeref
args.docString: Has an effect only if `marker.size` is set to a numerical array. Sets the scale factor used to determine the rendered size of marker points. Use with `sizemin` and `sizemode`.

args.name: sizemin
args.docString: Has an effect only if `marker.size` is set to a numerical array. Sets the minimum size (in px) of the rendered marker points.

args.name: sizemode
args.docString: Has an effect only if `marker.size` is set to a numerical array. Sets the rule for which the data in `size` is converted to pixels.

args.name: color
args.docString: Sets themarkercolor. It accepts either a specific color or an array of numbers that are mapped to the colorscale relative to the max and min values of the array or relative to `marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax` if set.

args.name: cauto
args.docString: Determines whether or not the color domain is computed with respect to the input data (here in `marker.color`) or the bounds set in `marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax`  Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Defaults to `false` when `marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax` are set by the user.

args.name: cmin
args.docString: Sets the lower bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.color` and if set, `marker.cmax` must be set as well.

args.name: cmax
args.docString: Sets the upper bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.color` and if set, `marker.cmin` must be set as well.

args.name: cmid
args.docString: Sets the mid-point of the color domain by scaling `marker.cmin` and/or `marker.cmax` to be equidistant to this point. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.color`. Has no effect when `marker.cauto` is `false`.

args.name: colorscale
args.docString: Sets the colorscale. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)'], [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use`marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys,YlGnBu,Greens,YlOrRd,Bluered,RdBu,Reds,Blues,Picnic,Rainbow,Portland,Jet,Hot,Blackbody,Earth,Electric,Viridis,Cividis.

args.name: autocolorscale
args.docString: Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette (`autocolorscale: true`) or the palette determined by `marker.colorscale`. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. In case `colorscale` is unspecified or `autocolorscale` is true, the default  palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the `color` array are all positive, all negative or mixed.

args.name: reversescale
args.docString: Reverses the color mapping if true. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. If true, `marker.cmin` will correspond to the last color in the array and `marker.cmax` will correspond to the first color.

args.name: showscale
args.docString: Determines whether or not a colorbar is displayed for this trace. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array.

args.name: coloraxis
args.docString: Sets a reference to a shared color axis. References to these shared color axes are *coloraxis*, *coloraxis2*, *coloraxis3*, etc. Settings for these shared color axes are set in the layout, under `layout.coloraxis`, `layout.coloraxis2`, etc. Note that multiple color scales can be linked to the same color axis.

args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  size .

size.name: number

sizeref.name: number
sizeref.docString: Has an effect only if `marker.size` is set to a numerical array. Sets the scale factor used to determine the rendered size of marker points. Use with `sizemin` and `sizemode`.

sizemin.name: number
sizemin.docString: Has an effect only if `marker.size` is set to a numerical array. Sets the minimum size (in px) of the rendered marker points.

sizemode.name: enumerated
sizemode.docString: Has an effect only if `marker.size` is set to a numerical array. Sets the rule for which the data in `size` is converted to pixels.

color.name: color
color.docString: Sets themarkercolor. It accepts either a specific color or an array of numbers that are mapped to the colorscale relative to the max and min values of the array or relative to `marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax` if set.

cauto.name: boolean
cauto.docString: Determines whether or not the color domain is computed with respect to the input data (here in `marker.color`) or the bounds set in `marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax`  Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Defaults to `false` when `marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax` are set by the user.

cmin.name: number
cmin.docString: Sets the lower bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.color` and if set, `marker.cmax` must be set as well.

cmax.name: number
cmax.docString: Sets the upper bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.color` and if set, `marker.cmin` must be set as well.

cmid.name: number
cmid.docString: Sets the mid-point of the color domain by scaling `marker.cmin` and/or `marker.cmax` to be equidistant to this point. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.color`. Has no effect when `marker.cauto` is `false`.

colorscale.name: colorscale
colorscale.docString: Sets the colorscale. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)'], [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use`marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys,YlGnBu,Greens,YlOrRd,Bluered,RdBu,Reds,Blues,Picnic,Rainbow,Portland,Jet,Hot,Blackbody,Earth,Electric,Viridis,Cividis.

autocolorscale.name: boolean
autocolorscale.docString: Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette (`autocolorscale: true`) or the palette determined by `marker.colorscale`. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. In case `colorscale` is unspecified or `autocolorscale` is true, the default  palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the `color` array are all positive, all negative or mixed.

reversescale.name: boolean
reversescale.docString: Reverses the color mapping if true. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. If true, `marker.cmin` will correspond to the last color in the array and `marker.cmax` will correspond to the first color.

showscale.name: boolean
showscale.docString: Determines whether or not a colorbar is displayed for this trace. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array.

coloraxis.name: subplotid
coloraxis.docString: Sets a reference to a shared color axis. References to these shared color axes are *coloraxis*, *coloraxis2*, *coloraxis3*, etc. Settings for these shared color axes are set in the layout, under `layout.coloraxis`, `layout.coloraxis2`, etc. Note that multiple color scales can be linked to the same color axis.

args.name: family
args.docString: HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The Chart Studio Cloud (at https://chart-studio.plotly.com or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*.

args.name: thicknessmode
args.docString: Determines whether this color bar's thickness (i.e. the measure in the constant color direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels*. Use `thickness` to set the value.

args.name: thickness
args.docString: Sets the thickness of the color bar This measure excludes the size of the padding, ticks and labels.

args.name: lenmode
args.docString: Determines whether this color bar's length (i.e. the measure in the color variation direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels. Use `len` to set the value.

args.name: len
args.docString: Sets the length of the color bar This measure excludes the padding of both ends. That is, the color bar length is this length minus the padding on both ends.

args.name: x
args.docString: Sets the x position of the color bar (in plot fraction).

args.name: xanchor
args.docString: Sets this color bar's horizontal position anchor. This anchor binds the `x` position to the *left*, *center* or *right* of the color bar.

args.name: xpad
args.docString: Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the x direction.

args.name: y
args.docString: Sets the y position of the color bar (in plot fraction).

args.name: yanchor
args.docString: Sets this color bar's vertical position anchor This anchor binds the `y` position to the *top*, *middle* or *bottom* of the color bar.

args.name: ypad
args.docString: Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the y direction.

args.name: outlinecolor
args.docString: Sets the axis line color.

args.name: outlinewidth
args.docString: Sets the width (in px) of the axis line.

args.name: bordercolor
args.docString: Sets the axis line color.

args.name: borderwidth
args.docString: Sets the width (in px) or the border enclosing this color bar.

args.name: bgcolor
args.docString: Sets the color of padded area.

args.name: tickmode
args.docString: Sets the tick mode for this axis. If *auto*, the number of ticks is set via `nticks`. If *linear*, the placement of the ticks is determined by a starting position `tick0` and a tick step `dtick` (*linear* is the default value if `tick0` and `dtick` are provided). If *array*, the placement of the ticks is set via `tickvals` and the tick text is `ticktext`. (*array* is the default value if `tickvals` is provided).

args.name: nticks
args.docString: Specifies the maximum number of ticks for the particular axis. The actual number of ticks will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to `nticks`. Has an effect only if `tickmode` is set to *auto*.

args.name: tick0
args.docString: Sets the placement of the first tick on this axis. Use with `dtick`. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your starting tick (e.g. to set the starting tick to 100, set the `tick0` to 2) except when `dtick`=*L<f>* (see `dtick` for more info). If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be a date string, like date data. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be a number, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears.

args.name: dtick
args.docString: Sets the step in-between ticks on this axis. Use with `tick0`. Must be a positive number, or special strings available to *log* and *date* axes. If the axis `type` is *log*, then ticks are set every 10^(n*dtick) where n is the tick number. For example, to set a tick mark at 1, 10, 100, 1000, ... set dtick to 1. To set tick marks at 1, 100, 10000, ... set dtick to 2. To set tick marks at 1, 5, 25, 125, 625, 3125, ... set dtick to log_10(5), or 0.69897000433. *log* has several special values; *L<f>*, where `f` is a positive number, gives ticks linearly spaced in value (but not position). For example `tick0` = 0.1, `dtick` = *L0.5* will put ticks at 0.1, 0.6, 1.1, 1.6 etc. To show powers of 10 plus small digits between, use *D1* (all digits) or *D2* (only 2 and 5). `tick0` is ignored for *D1* and *D2*. If the axis `type` is *date*, then you must convert the time to milliseconds. For example, to set the interval between ticks to one day, set `dtick` to 86400000.0. *date* also has special values *M<n>* gives ticks spaced by a number of months. `n` must be a positive integer. To set ticks on the 15th of every third month, set `tick0` to *2000-01-15* and `dtick` to *M3*. To set ticks every 4 years, set `dtick` to *M48*

args.name: tickvals
args.docString: Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `ticktext`.

args.name: ticktext
args.docString: Sets the text displayed at the ticks position via `tickvals`. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `tickvals`.

args.name: ticks
args.docString: Determines whether ticks are drawn or not. If **, this axis' ticks are not drawn. If *outside* (*inside*), this axis' are drawn outside (inside) the axis lines.

args.name: ticklabelposition
args.docString: Determines where tick labels are drawn.

args.name: ticklen
args.docString: Sets the tick length (in px).

args.name: tickwidth
args.docString: Sets the tick width (in px).

args.name: tickcolor
args.docString: Sets the tick color.

args.name: showticklabels
args.docString: Determines whether or not the tick labels are drawn.

args.name: tickfont
args.docString: Sets the color bar's tick label font

args.name: tickangle
args.docString: Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the horizontal. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically.

args.name: tickformat
args.docString: Sets the tick label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46*

args.name: tickprefix
args.docString: Sets a tick label prefix.

args.name: showtickprefix
args.docString: If *all*, all tick labels are displayed with a prefix. If *first*, only the first tick is displayed with a prefix. If *last*, only the last tick is displayed with a suffix. If *none*, tick prefixes are hidden.

args.name: ticksuffix
args.docString: Sets a tick label suffix.

args.name: showticksuffix
args.docString: Same as `showtickprefix` but for tick suffixes.

args.name: separatethousands
args.docString: If "true", even 4-digit integers are separated

args.name: exponentformat
args.docString: Determines a formatting rule for the tick exponents. For example, consider the number 1,000,000,000. If *none*, it appears as 1,000,000,000. If *e*, 1e+9. If *E*, 1E+9. If *power*, 1x10^9 (with 9 in a super script). If *SI*, 1G. If *B*, 1B.

args.name: minexponent
args.docString: Hide SI prefix for 10^n if |n| is below this number. This only has an effect when `tickformat` is *SI* or *B*.

args.name: showexponent
args.docString: If *all*, all exponents are shown besides their significands. If *first*, only the exponent of the first tick is shown. If *last*, only the exponent of the last tick is shown. If *none*, no exponents appear.

args.name: tickvalssrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  tickvals .

args.name: ticktextsrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  ticktext .

To set tick marks at 1, 100, 10000, ... set dtick to 2. To set tick marks at 1, 5, 25, 125, 625, 3125, ... set dtick to log_10(5), or 0.69897000433. *log* has several special values; *L<f>*, where `f` is a positive number, gives ticks linearly spaced in value (but not position). For example `tick0` = 0.1, `dtick` = *L0.5* will put ticks at 0.1, 0.6, 1.1, 1.6 etc. To show powers of 10 plus small digits between, use *D1* (all digits) or *D2* (only 2 and 5). `tick0` is ignored for *D1* and *D2*. If the axis `type` is *date*, then you must convert the time to milliseconds. For example, to set the interval between ticks to one day, set `dtick` to 86400000.0. *date* also has special values *M<n>* gives ticks spaced by a number of months. `n` must be a positive integer. To set ticks on the 15th of every third month, set `tick0` to *2000-01-15* and `dtick` to *M3*. To set ticks every 4 years, set `dtick` to *M48*

tickvals.name: data_array
tickvals.docString: Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `ticktext`.

ticktext.name: data_array
ticktext.docString: Sets the text displayed at the ticks position via `tickvals`. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `tickvals`.

ticks.name: enumerated
ticks.docString: Determines whether ticks are drawn or not. If **, this axis' ticks are not drawn. If *outside* (*inside*), this axis' are drawn outside (inside) the axis lines.

ticklabelposition.name: enumerated
ticklabelposition.docString: Determines where tick labels are drawn.

showticklabels.name: boolean
showticklabels.docString: Determines whether or not the tick labels are drawn.

tickangle.name: angle
tickangle.docString: Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the horizontal. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically.

tickformat.name: string
tickformat.docString: Sets the tick label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46*

showtickprefix.name: enumerated
showtickprefix.docString: If *all*, all tick labels are displayed with a prefix. If *first*, only the first tick is displayed with a prefix. If *last*, only the last tick is displayed with a suffix. If *none*, tick prefixes are hidden.

showticksuffix.name: enumerated
showticksuffix.docString: Same as `showtickprefix` but for tick suffixes.

exponentformat.name: enumerated
exponentformat.docString: Determines a formatting rule for the tick exponents. For example, consider the number 1,000,000,000. If *none*, it appears as 1,000,000,000. If *e*, 1e+9. If *E*, 1E+9. If *power*, 1x10^9 (with 9 in a super script). If *SI*, 1G. If *B*, 1B.

minexponent.name: number
minexponent.docString: Hide SI prefix for 10^n if |n| is below this number. This only has an effect when `tickformat` is *SI* or *B*.

showexponent.name: enumerated
showexponent.docString: If *all*, all exponents are shown besides their significands. If *first*, only the exponent of the first tick is shown. If *last*, only the exponent of the last tick is shown. If *none*, no exponents appear.

tickvalssrc.name: string
tickvalssrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  tickvals .

ticktextsrc.name: string
ticktextsrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  ticktext .

args.name: family
args.docString: HTML font family - the typeface that will be applied by the web browser. The web browser will only be able to apply a font if it is available on the system which it operates. Provide multiple font families, separated by commas, to indicate the preference in which to apply fonts if they aren't available on the system. The Chart Studio Cloud (at https://chart-studio.plotly.com or on-premise) generates images on a server, where only a select number of fonts are installed and supported. These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*.

args.name: enabled

args.name: dtickrange
args.docString: range [*min*, *max*], where *min*, *max* - dtick values which describe some zoom level, it is possible to omit *min* or *max* value by passing *null*

args.name: value
args.docString: string - dtickformat for described zoom level, the same as *tickformat*

args.name: name
args.docString: When used in a template, named items are created in the output figure in addition to any items the figure already has in this array. You can modify these items in the output figure by making your own item with `templateitemname` matching this `name` alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). Has no effect outside of a template.

args.name: templateitemname
args.docString: Used to refer to a named item in this array in the template. Named items from the template will be created even without a matching item in the input figure, but you can modify one by making an item with `templateitemname` matching its `name`, alongside your modifications (including `visible: false` or `enabled: false` to hide it). If there is no template or no matching item, this item will be hidden unless you explicitly show it with `visible: true`.

These include *Arial*, *Balto*, *Courier New*, *Droid Sans*,, *Droid Serif*, *Droid Sans Mono*, *Gravitas One*, *Old Standard TT*, *Open Sans*, *Overpass*, *PT Sans Narrow*, *Raleway*, *Times New Roman*.

args.name: color
args.docString: Sets themarkercolor. It accepts either a specific color or an array of numbers that are mapped to the colorscale relative to the max and min values of the array or relative to `marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax` if set.

args.name: cauto
args.docString: Determines whether or not the color domain is computed with respect to the input data (here in `marker.color`) or the bounds set in `marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax`  Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Defaults to `false` when `marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax` are set by the user.

args.name: cmin
args.docString: Sets the lower bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.color` and if set, `marker.cmax` must be set as well.

args.name: cmax
args.docString: Sets the upper bound of the color domain. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.color` and if set, `marker.cmin` must be set as well.

args.name: cmid
args.docString: Sets the mid-point of the color domain by scaling `marker.cmin` and/or `marker.cmax` to be equidistant to this point. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. Value should have the same units as in `marker.color`. Has no effect when `marker.cauto` is `false`.

args.name: colorscale
args.docString: Sets the colorscale. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. The colorscale must be an array containing arrays mapping a normalized value to an rgb, rgba, hex, hsl, hsv, or named color string. At minimum, a mapping for the lowest (0) and highest (1) values are required. For example, `[[0, 'rgb(0,0,255)'], [1, 'rgb(255,0,0)']]`. To control the bounds of the colorscale in color space, use`marker.cmin` and `marker.cmax`. Alternatively, `colorscale` may be a palette name string of the following list: Greys,YlGnBu,Greens,YlOrRd,Bluered,RdBu,Reds,Blues,Picnic,Rainbow,Portland,Jet,Hot,Blackbody,Earth,Electric,Viridis,Cividis.

args.name: autocolorscale
args.docString: Determines whether the colorscale is a default palette (`autocolorscale: true`) or the palette determined by `marker.colorscale`. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. In case `colorscale` is unspecified or `autocolorscale` is true, the default  palette will be chosen according to whether numbers in the `color` array are all positive, all negative or mixed.

args.name: reversescale
args.docString: Reverses the color mapping if true. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array. If true, `marker.cmin` will correspond to the last color in the array and `marker.cmax` will correspond to the first color.

args.name: showscale
args.docString: Determines whether or not a colorbar is displayed for this trace. Has an effect only if in `marker.color`is set to a numerical array.

args.name: coloraxis
args.docString: Sets a reference to a shared color axis. References to these shared color axes are *coloraxis*, *coloraxis2*, *coloraxis3*, etc. Settings for these shared color axes are set in the layout, under `layout.coloraxis`, `layout.coloraxis2`, etc. Note that multiple color scales can be linked to the same color axis.

args.name: opacity
args.docString: Sets the opacity of the bars.

args.name: colorsrc
args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  color .

args.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  opacity .

colorsrc.docString: Sets the source reference on Chart Studio Cloud for  color .

args.name: thicknessmode
args.docString: Determines whether this color bar's thickness (i.e. the measure in the constant color direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels*. Use `thickness` to set the value.

args.name: thickness
args.docString: Sets the thickness of the color bar This measure excludes the size of the padding, ticks and labels.

args.name: lenmode
args.docString: Determines whether this color bar's length (i.e. the measure in the color variation direction) is set in units of plot *fraction* or in *pixels. Use `len` to set the value.

args.name: len
args.docString: Sets the length of the color bar This measure excludes the padding of both ends. That is, the color bar length is this length minus the padding on both ends.

args.name: x
args.docString: Sets the x position of the color bar (in plot fraction).

args.name: xanchor
args.docString: Sets this color bar's horizontal position anchor. This anchor binds the `x` position to the *left*, *center* or *right* of the color bar.

args.name: xpad
args.docString: Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the x direction.

args.name: y
args.docString: Sets the y position of the color bar (in plot fraction).

args.name: yanchor
args.docString: Sets this color bar's vertical position anchor This anchor binds the `y` position to the *top*, *middle* or *bottom* of the color bar.

args.name: ypad
args.docString: Sets the amount of padding (in px) along the y direction.

args.name: outlinecolor
args.docString: Sets the axis line color.

args.name: outlinewidth
args.docString: Sets the width (in px) of the axis line.

args.name: bordercolor
args.docString: Sets the axis line color.

args.name: borderwidth
args.docString: Sets the width (in px) or the border enclosing this color bar.

args.name: bgcolor
args.docString: Sets the color of padded area.

args.name: tickmode
args.docString: Sets the tick mode for this axis. If *auto*, the number of ticks is set via `nticks`. If *linear*, the placement of the ticks is determined by a starting position `tick0` and a tick step `dtick` (*linear* is the default value if `tick0` and `dtick` are provided). If *array*, the placement of the ticks is set via `tickvals` and the tick text is `ticktext`. (*array* is the default value if `tickvals` is provided).

args.name: nticks
args.docString: Specifies the maximum number of ticks for the particular axis. The actual number of ticks will be chosen automatically to be less than or equal to `nticks`. Has an effect only if `tickmode` is set to *auto*.

args.name: tick0
args.docString: Sets the placement of the first tick on this axis. Use with `dtick`. If the axis `type` is *log*, then you must take the log of your starting tick (e.g. to set the starting tick to 100, set the `tick0` to 2) except when `dtick`=*L<f>* (see `dtick` for more info). If the axis `type` is *date*, it should be a date string, like date data. If the axis `type` is *category*, it should be a number, using the scale where each category is assigned a serial number from zero in the order it appears.

args.name: dtick
args.docString: Sets the step in-between ticks on this axis. Use with `tick0`. Must be a positive number, or special strings available to *log* and *date* axes. If the axis `type` is *log*, then ticks are set every 10^(n*dtick) where n is the tick number. For example, to set a tick mark at 1, 10, 100, 1000, ... set dtick to 1. To set tick marks at 1, 100, 10000, ... set dtick to 2. To set tick marks at 1, 5, 25, 125, 625, 3125, ... set dtick to log_10(5), or 0.69897000433. *log* has several special values; *L<f>*, where `f` is a positive number, gives ticks linearly spaced in value (but not position). For example `tick0` = 0.1, `dtick` = *L0.5* will put ticks at 0.1, 0.6, 1.1, 1.6 etc. To show powers of 10 plus small digits between, use *D1* (all digits) or *D2* (only 2 and 5). `tick0` is ignored for *D1* and *D2*. If the axis `type` is *date*, then you must convert the time to milliseconds. For example, to set the interval between ticks to one day, set `dtick` to 86400000.0. *date* also has special values *M<n>* gives ticks spaced by a number of months. `n` must be a positive integer. To set ticks on the 15th of every third month, set `tick0` to *2000-01-15* and `dtick` to *M3*. To set ticks every 4 years, set `dtick` to *M48*

args.name: tickvals
args.docString: Sets the values at which ticks on this axis appear. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `ticktext`.

args.name: ticktext
args.docString: Sets the text displayed at the ticks position via `tickvals`. Only has an effect if `tickmode` is set to *array*. Used with `tickvals`.

args.name: ticks
args.docString: Determines whether ticks are drawn or not. If **, this axis' ticks are not drawn. If *outside* (*inside*), this axis' are drawn outside (inside) the axis lines.

args.name: ticklabelposition
args.docString: Determines where tick labels are drawn.

args.name: ticklen
args.docString: Sets the tick length (in px).

args.name: tickwidth
args.docString: Sets the tick width (in px).

args.name: tickcolor
args.docString: Sets the tick color.

args.name: showticklabels
args.docString: Determines whether or not the tick labels are drawn.

args.name: tickfont
args.docString: Sets the color bar's tick label font

args.name: tickangle
args.docString: Sets the angle of the tick labels with respect to the horizontal. For example, a `tickangle` of -90 draws the tick labels vertically.

args.name: tickformat
args.docString: Sets the tick label formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see: https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/Formatting.md#d3_format And for dates see: https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format#locale_format We add one item to d3's date formatter: *%{n}f* for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, *2016-10-13 09:15:23.456* with tickformat *%H~%M~%S.%2f* would display *09~15~23.46*

args.name: tickprefix
args.docString: Sets a tick label prefix.

args.name: showtickprefix
args.docString: If *all*, all tick labels are displayed with a prefix. If *first*, only the first tick is displayed with a prefix. If *last*, only the last tick is displayed with a suffix. If *none*, tick prefixes are hidden.

args.name: ticksuffix
args.docString: Sets a tick label suffix.

args.name: showticksuffix
args.docString: Same as `showtickprefix` but for tick suffixes.

args.name: separatethousands
args.docString: If "true", even 4-digit integers are separated

args.name: exponentformat
args.docString: Determines a formatting rule for the tick exponents. For example, consider the number 1,000,000,000. If *none*, it appears as 1,000,000,000. If *e*, 1e+9. If *E*, 1E+9. If *power*, 1x10^9 (with 9 in a super script). If *SI*, 1G. If *B*, 1B.

args.name: minexponent
args.docString: Hide SI prefix for 10^n if |n| is below this number. This only has an effect when `tickformat` is *SI* or *B*.

args.name: showexponent
args.docString: If *all*, all exponents are shown besides their significands. If *first*, only the exponent of the first tick is shown. If *last*, only the exponent of the last tick is shown. If *none*, no exponents appear.
